0,Data Analyst Co-op (Spring term),"St. Catharines, ON",Ridley College (Canada),https://ca.indeed.com/rc/clk?jk=4aafa08c370b8744&fccid=31dce77bae252289&vjs=3,"[[

Position Title: Data Analyst Co-op (Spring term)
THE RIDLEY DIFFERENCE

Founded in 1889, Ridley College is a co-educational boarding and day school with over 700 students in JK to grade 12 from more than 50 countries worldwide. The Ridley experience integrates a traditional liberal arts education with individual learning enhanced by the principles of positive psychology, the International Baccalaureate continuum program, a learner-driven culture and campus community, exceptional athletics and dynamic arts programs, and a commitment of service to others. This unique combination prepares meaningful and flourishing lives by teaching the habits of mind, body and spirit, and the values needed to lead in a global society.
Ridley College is located on 90 acres in St. Catharines, Ontario in the heart of the Niagara Peninsula and is comprised of a stunning blend of century old buildings housing modernized technology.
OUR TEAM

Ridley offers the prospect of being part of a high-performance team in a nourishing workplace community that encourages collaboration, innovation, inclusivity and curious minds, and where grit and perseverance are assets. Joining the team at Ridley means you are committed to life-long learning and development, have integrity, and value being of service in a richly diverse community. We cultivate the full potential in each of our students by having a caring, committed and world-class team. Attracting, developing and retaining people who thrive in Ridley’s positive education culture that recognizes and celebrates individual strengths is critical to our success.
OVERVIEW

This position is in an IT service desk environment, assisting Ridley’s community with data and analytics solutions and network connectivity problems with a strong emphasis on customer service and support. In addition, the individual with be a crucial stakeholder in completing innovative IT projects during the summer months.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Respond with prompt first-person customer service
Responsible for completing data requests for various stakeholders
Collaborate with various areas of the school to build data marts to assist with decision making
Support the creation of the schools data architecture
Ensure the data integrity of the schools information system
Create appropriate documentation that allows stakeholders to understand the steps of the data analysis process
Build analytical dashboards to help identify trends for the Admissions and Development teams
Assist in building knowledge base articles for students, staff and parents
Support the implementation of networking projects, new technology and security improvement projects across the campus
Responsible for summer preventative maintenance across the campus
Perform other duties as assigned.
QUALIFICATIONS
Enrolled in a post-secondary Computer Science or Programming program
Provide excellent customer service and be able to work in a collaborative environment
Be a self-motivated and well-organized individual
Ability to assess and troubleshoot a variety of problems and issues as they arise
Ability to identify problem trends and broader technology issues, and research and recommend solutions
Ability to identify and assess emerging trends and technologies, and determine their applicability to the school/college.
TECHNICAL SKILLS
Understanding of both Mac OS X and Microsoft Windows operating systems
Advanced knowledge of MS Office suite specifically with Excel
Understanding of object-oriented programming languages such as Python, Java
Knowledge of Pandas and NumPy would be an asset
Understanding of database related languages such as SQL
Experience with data visualization tools such as PowerBi or Tableau would be an asset
Understanding of scripting languages such as PowerShell or BASH
Understanding of networking environments (LAN, WAN &amp
OUR OFFER
Ridley College offers a positive and inclusive workplace community with a competitive compensation package
column3: a learning environment that promotes professional development and personal growth
column5: and, a beautiful campus setting in the heart of Niagara that engages and inspires our employees to flourish.

column1: HOW TO APPLY
Qualified applicants are encouraged to upload a resume and cover letter in the fields on the right side of this page.
Deadline for applications is: January 15, 2021

As a condition of employment, a satisfactory Vulnerable Persons Screening Report must be provided. While all applicants are thanked for their interest, only those chosen for interviews will be contacted.

Ridley College is committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible and equitable environment where everyone feels respected, valued and supported. Accommodations are available for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment process. If you are selected to participate in the recruitment process, please inform Human Resources of the nature of any accommodation(s) that you may require in respect of any materials or processes used in order to ensure your equal participation.

“We inspire flourishing lives to transform our globe.”]]"

column2: Johnson Inc. is one of the most trusted brands in the world and the undisputed leader in the healthcare industry. With operations in over 60 countries and a breadth of products spanning across Pharmaceuticals, Medical Devices and Consumer Health Products. Johnson &amp
column3: Johnson Inc. is the company best positioned to bring holistic healthcare solutions to patients and healthcare professionals alike.

column1: At Janssen, we take pride in being the #1 Pharmaceutical company in Canada. we are dedicated to addressing and solving some of the most important unmet medical needs of our time in oncology, immunology, neuroscience, infectious diseases and vaccines, metabolic and chronic diseases and women’s health. Motivated by our commitment to patients, we bring innovative products, services and solutions to people throughout the world. Please visit www.janssen.ca for more information.

We offer a work culture that is open, creative, and performance driven with an environment that is fun and sophisticated. Within our facilities we have a fitness center that you can access and an online company store, exclusive to employees, where you can purchase J&
column2: J products. We also offer opportunities for employees to get involved in sports teams, social events and to volunteer with local charities.

column1: Position Overview

Janssen is looking for hardworking and driven student leaders to join our team as a Data Analytics Associate Intern in our Toronto office. The internships will run for 4-month period beginning in May 2021 and will give you the opportunity to support and lead commercial projects within a Janssen business unit. Upon completion of the internship, top performing candidates may be considered for a full-time role.
The area of focus for our summer internship is as follows:
Data Management &
• Development and maintenance of a comprehensive customer database ensuring effective integration of key customer intelligence from a variety of sources
• Evolving and handling cross functional processes to ensure data integrity and compliance across a numerous and diverse user community
<li>Providing user support and training across this community for CRM and other related J&amp
• Champion the use of data to drive decision-making across the organization.
• Throughout your internship you will be exposed to world-class experts who will guide your learning through daily support, mentorship and constructive feedback
Qualifications
<ul>
• You are a student in good standing, working towards the completion of an MBA or related graduate degree with prior education or experience in Information Technology/Engineering Graduating in 2022
• Excellent verbal, presentation and communication skills, and a strong ability to collaborate and partner are required

• You can work independently, have strong project management and organizational skills, strong financial and business acumen, the ability to establish rapport and relationships, and possess well-developed analytical abilities
Do you want to join a global health care company where what you do matters and makes a difference? If you meet the above requirements, this opportunity we would love to meet you.
BE VITAL in your career. Be seen for the talent you bring to your work. Explore opportunities within the Johnson &

column2: Johnson Family of Companies. Attracting, developing and retaining a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities is essential to our success. We are committed to providing a respectful, inclusive and accessible work environment where all employees have the opportunity to achieve their potential.

What is the opportunity?
Are you interested in the opportunity to work as a Data Analyst Student? By applying to this job posting, you will be considered for multiple roles available across RBC Technology &amp
column2: Operations. Some exciting areas you may be able to contribute to are:

column1: Innovation &amp
Global Technology Infrastructure
Enterprise Operations Payments
What will you do?
Analyze, design, deliver, and implement analytic development projects, with the use of RBC’s analytics tools
Ensure that project activities are accomplished within approved time frames, scope, and budgets
Confirm that projects adhere to development standards and guidelines
Apply data warehouse concepts and methodologies to various projects
What do you need to succeed?
Must-have
Currently enrolled at a Canadian post-secondary institution with a focus on computer science, mathematics, statistics, commerce, or business analysis
Leadership acumen and a passion to apply it in a dynamic business environment
Excellent interpersonal and highly developed communication skills (verbal and written)
Creative and analytical thinker who is self-driven and capable of working in a fast paced environment
Strong MS Office skills – Word, Outlook, Excel and PowerPoint
Experience or understanding of open-source software frameworks (Hadoop), data visualization tools (Tableau and Splunk), and databases (SQL and/or VBA)
Nice-to-have
Prior experience in data integration of disparate data sources
Knowledge of design, development, and implementation utilizing current analytics technologies and architecture, as well as data warehouse concepts and methodologies
Relational database concepts and design experience
Ability to learn and absorb new concepts (in business and in systems) quickly and apply new knowledge
What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
Network and build lasting relationships with students from diverse backgrounds from across Canada
Participate in fun events and gamification challenges to help build your career tool kit while enjoying a work-life balance
Leaders who support your development through coaching and learning opportunities
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive and highly performing team
Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
Enjoy a comfortable work environment with the option to dress casually

We encourage you to apply as soon as possible as we accept applications on a rolling basis, but please note that the formal application deadline is March 14, 2021. Should you be selected to progress, someone from our team will reach out directly to provide instructions on next steps. Otherwise, feel free to check for progress updates by logging in to your RBC profile. If the status has not changed, it denotes the fact that your application is still under review.

While there is no one date when our employees will return, we can confirm that the majority of Summer Work Integrated Learning | Co-op positions will start working remotely, however may transition to working at an RBC office as essential service restrictions are lifted.

Address: Various

Work Environment: Office
Career Level: Student Job
Position Level: PL11

3,"Data Scientist, Summer Student 2021 Opportunities","Toronto, ON",RBC,https://ca.indeed.com/rc/clk?jk=1bdf42b3d5b3e409&fccid=537b899e30af3338&vjs=3,"[[

What is the opportunity?

The Data Scientist role at RBC offers the opportunity to leverage RBC’s data assets to develop innovative solutions in support of RBCs big data strategy. The position is mandated to aid RBC, as it develops next-generation applications to meet our customers’ needs. Joining the RBC team as a Data Scientist, you will have the opportunity to analyze, design and implement data solutions to assist all business customers.
What will you do?
Utilizing the latest technologies available, designing and building data solutions to meet business needs
Be an active contributor to not only your individual team, but to the RBC development community
Constantly seek out better ways to do things, new tools, new technologies, new processes
Work on transformational projects delivering new value
Work as part of an agile team responsible for end-to-end delivery of business needs
Deploy production-scale solutions using the Hadoop Ecosystem, transforming statistical and machine learning models from single node architecture to parallel processing grid technology
Use business domain knowledge to independently lead the analytics process to identify valuable and innovative insights
Promote analytics across the enterprise to enable RBC to become a data-driven organization
What do you need to succeed?
Must-have:
Advanced programming skills in one or more of the following languages: Python or R
Extensive experience utilizing SQL scripts/querying

Proficient in building statistical and algorithmic models with complex and large datasets, including but not limited to: supervised statistical learning, clustering, natural language processing, recommendation systems, times-series analysis, experimental design (A/B testing), data visualization, deep learning
Expert in data extract, transform, and load processes with a variety of data types
Ability to perform complex data analysis on large volumes of data and present findings to stakeholders
Nice to have:
Experience with big data technologies, primarily in machine learning and statistics function
Exposure to Apache Spark, Hadoop and Public Cloud technologies
Experience with big data processing tools like Spark and Hive
GitHub functionality and workflow experience/exposure
Experience with data serialization (JSON, Avro, Parquet, ORC)
Experience with messaging (Kafka, Solace, RabbitMQ)
Experience working on Agile projects
What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients succeed. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities and achieving success that is mutual. Visit people.rbc.com
Continued career advancement opportunities
Exposure to strong mentorship and leadership examples
A world-class training program in financial services
Opportunities to be a valuable member of a close-knit, collaborative team that encourages networking
A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits
Competitive compensation

We encourage you to apply as soon as possible as we accept applications on a rolling basis, but please note that the formal application deadline is March 14, 2021. Should you be selected to progress, someone from our team will reach out directly to provide instructions on next steps. Otherwise, feel free to check for progress updates by logging in to your RBC profile. If the status has not changed, it denotes the fact that your application is still under review.

While there is no one date when our employees will return, we can confirm that the majority of Summer Work Integrated Learning | Co-op positions will start working remotely, however may transition to working at an RBC office as essential service restrictions are lifted.

Learn more about RBC Tech Jobs

6,Business Intelligence and Analytics Internship (Winter 2021),"Toronto, ON",Travelers,https://ca.indeed.com/rc/clk?jk=b054e0838af82ba5&fccid=614604a6208fa23b&vjs=3,"[[

Company Information

Solid reputation, passionate people and endless opportunities. That’s Travelers. Our superior financial strength and consistent record of strong operating returns mean security for our customers – and opportunities for our employees. You will find Travelers to be full of energy and a workplace in which you truly can make a difference.
Target Openings
Job Description Summary
The Business Intelligence &amp
column2: Analytics Internship Program provides qualified students with an excellent opportunity to gain first-hand experience, receive valuable on-the-job training and learn more about the property &amp
column3: casualty insurance industry.

column1: This role is an exciting opportunity to work with one of the largest employers of insurance personnel in North America. As a BI&amp
column2: A Assistant, the successful candidate will be offered an opportunity to gain relevant property and casualty insurance and business experience in personal and/or commercial lines while working in a dynamic, team-focused environment.

column1: As a member of the BI&amp
column2: A Department, the candidate will act as an effective contributor to their team, and will interact with insurance professionals from underwriting, claims, finance and information systems as necessary.

column1: The candidate will be responsible for a range of projects and tasks which will involve interaction with many areas of the business. Under close to moderate supervision, explore and profile data, draw business inferences, complete analysis and clearly articulate findings for a target audience. This position is accountable for performing less complex core tasks of Descriptive Analytics (the exploration and investigation of past business performance), and partnering with team members on more complex tasks.
Primary Job Duties &amp

Each intern will be expected to complete challenging and meaningful project work over the course of this program. In addition, there are core assignments and a designated coach to further develop interns' insurance knowledge.
Duties may include:
Data preparation, validation, reconciliation and analysis of premium, claims and other data
Using software such as SAS, SQL, MS Access and Excel to produce analyses and reporting
Selects appropriate relevant data and extracts from various internal and external sources.
Manipulates raw data sets into information fit for analysis applying needed logic. May require additional information from subject matter expert.
Presents analysis and recommendations to team members and manager.
Contributes to development of reporting to monitor business critical results
Managing multiple projects simultaneously
Developing product knowledge
Responding to ad hoc business needs
Working with actuarial colleagues from other business areas
Supporting implementation of IT projects and business initiatives
Minimum Qualifications :
Education, Work Experience &amp

For this internship opportunity, we are most interested in students who are serious about entering the insurance industry and who are excited about the prospect of making underwriting their future career choice.
Preferred cumulative GPA of 3.0 or above. Undergraduate students completing their 3rd or final year is preferred.
Targeted Majors:
Actuarial Science, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Data Science, Statistics or equivalent.
Job Specific &amp
column3: Competencies

column1: Strong academic record
Strong verbal communication skills
Skilled independent problem solver
Self-motivated team player
Detail oriented
Proficiency with Microsoft Excel
Knowledge of Microsoft Access, SSIS SQL considered an asset
Prior BIA experience considered an asset
Legally eligible to work in Canada.
Equal Employment Opportunity Statement

Travelers is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing accommodation to persons with disabilities. If you require accommodation during the recruitment or interview process we will work with you to accommodate your needs.

]]"

7,Replenishment Optimization Intern Data and Analytics,"Brampton, ON",Loblaw Companies Limited,https://ca.indeed.com/rc/clk?jk=0ca94adcf861df19&fccid=bc30630cfcc120d4&vjs=3,"[[

Lieu:
1 Presidents Choice Circle, Brampton, Ontario, L6Y 5S5
C’est toute une décision que de se joindre à une entreprise. Nous offrons des perspectives d’emploi à des personnes qui, comme vous, sont travaillantes, dynamiques et fiables.
Pourquoi ce role est-il important?
About Us:

The Loblaw Supply Chain is the heart of our business and is committed to making customers our number one priority. As a member of our dynamic Supply Chain network, you will play a role in ensuring our product – nearly 1billion units of it – makes its way from one of our 3,000 vendors, through one of our 27 distribution centres , to one of our 2,300 locations across Canada, and into the homes of millions of Canadians each year. How’s that for a challenge?

If acting as the glue that connects our business together – whether in forecasting, purchasing, analytics, logistics, transportation and distribution, or space planning – appeals to you, we have a feeling a career with the Loblaw Supply Chain is the change you’ve been looking for. If you think so too, we’d love to hear from you.
Position Overview:

As a part of the Replenishment Optimization team, the Loblaw co-op student will be leveraging advanced process optimization techniques, to identify opportunities, develop solutions and integrate them into our core business processes. Our co-op program touches all aspects of replenishment including forecasting, inventory optimization, operations management, and reporting and analytics.
A successful co-op colleague will be:
• A motivated self-started
• A relentless problem solver
• Motivated to learn new concepts and techniques
• Comfortable working on their own and within a team
• Excited about the opportunity to present to company executives
• Focused on improving processes for our stores and customers
• Comfortable working in a professional environment interacting with all levels within the organization
Accountabilities :
• Provide reporting solutions to support business performance
• Provide analytical insight from large volumes of data to drive efficiency within the supply chain team
• S upport the decision making process thru the optimal mix of descriptive, predictive and prescriptive analytics
• Create documentation to support supply chain reports (SOPs, job aids , flow charts, etc . )
• Act as a point of contact for reporting questions and issues
Qualifications:
• Post-secondary education in computer science or engineering
• Must have strong computer skills. Highly proficient in MS Excel, Access, SAS, SQL
• Must have experience with Power BI and Python
• Must have experience creating robust reports
• Proven analytical and problem solving skills. Solid experience in developing and providing accurate reporting
Comment R é ussir:

Chez Loblaw, nous recherchons toujours des personnes formidables pour continuellement renforcer notre culture. Nous croyons que les gens formidables façonnent nos valeurs, sont authentiques, bâtissent la confiance et créent des liens.

Si cela vous ressemble et que vous êtes ouvert d’esprit, que vous avez une bonne attitude face aux changements et que vous aimez les défis d’un environnement de travail aux détails dynamiques, postulez aujourd’hui.
En outre, nous croyons que la conformité aux lois consiste à faire ce qu'il faut. Le respect de la loi fait partie de notre Code de conduite
column2: il renforce ce que nos clients et nos parties prenantes attendent de nous.

Temps plein
Role:
Poste contractuel (Durée déterminée)
Type of Contract:

Loblaw considère que la diversité culturelle du Canada est une source de fierté nationale et un symbole de force. Nous nous sommes donné comme priorité de refléter la diversité croissante du Canada dans les produits que nous vendons, les gens que nous embauchons et notre culture d’entreprise. Des accommodements sont disponibles sur demande pour les postulants et collègues atteints d’un handicap.

The Loblaw Supply Chain is the heart of our business and is committed to making customers our number one priority. As a member of our dynamic Supply Chain network, you will play a role in ensuring our product – nearly 1billion units of it – makes its way from one of our 3,000 vendors, through one of our 27 distribution centres , to one of our 2,300 locations across Canada, and into the homes of millions of Canadians each year. How You’ll Succeed:
At Loblaw, we seek great people to continually strengthen our culture. We believe great people model our values, are authentic, build trust and make connections.
If that sounds like you, and you are open-minded, responsive to change and up to the challenges provided in a fast-paced retail environment, apply today.
In addition, we believe that compliance with laws is about doing the right thing. Upholding the law is part of our Code of Conduct – it reinforces what our customers and stakeholders expect of us.

Full time

Temporary (Fixed Term)
Type of Contract:

Prodigy Education connects students, parents, teachers and school districts with resources that promote a lifelong love of learning. Anyone with an internet connection is welcome to create a free account and try the most effective and engaging K-8 math platform in the world. Our business model helps us connect with youth around the world, with over 100 million students now voluntarily practicing math every single day — and enjoying it!

At Prodigy Education, we have an incredible team that works tirelessly to turn our goal of making education a human right into a reality. We are immensely grateful for our amazing team and all they do every day. We welcome people who share our passion to join our team, where you will have the opportunity to help an entire generation of students to LOVE learning.
<div><i>
Our passion is our mission - to help every student in the world love learning!
<div>
Please note: During the Covid-19 pandemic, in order to keep all our candidates safe, Prodigy is hiring and on-boarding 100% remotely for the time being.
Overview:

Our data and marketing teams are scaling rapidly as we continue to hit our product and growth milestones! The work you do here will aid the educational advancement of millions of students. You will have the chance to apply your analytics skills to not only help kids learn but also help our marketing team to make better decisions.

We are looking for a marketing data analytics expert to join our growing team. As we scale our marketing efforts, the team will be looking to you for insights on the effectiveness of initiatives, and opportunities for optimization and growth. You will have the chance to apply your marketing analytics expertise to add real strategic value and ensure that we are asking and answering the right questions.
Your Impact:
Collaborate with data analysts, data scientists, data engineers, and team leads to create solutions which will directly affect Prodigy’s growth
Help our marketing team explore, analyze, and understand their data to help marketing make channel investment decisions
Improve data visibility by building dashboards and charts to inform strategy, and capture market and user insights
Benchmark performance across all channels and inform campaign optimization based on performance analysis
Work with the marketing and data teams to improve data quality to provide high quality insights and recommendations
Help design, execute, and evaluate experiments (e.g., A/A, A/B, multivariate tests etc)
Communicate insights, analysis, and recommendations clearly and accurately to stakeholders with a variety of technical and non-technical backgrounds.
Who You Are:
At least 2 years demonstrated analytics experience
Expert skills and knowledge of SQL
Expertise in working with various BI platforms (Tableau, Looker, Periscope)
Experience working with A/B testing and experimentation
Experience in marketing analytics
Ability to work simultaneously on different projects with a variety of timelines
Ability to translate data insights into actionable steps
A team and customer centric mindset
Love for our mission of helping kids everywhere enjoy learning
Bonus Points For:
Experience in cloud ecosystems and their data tooling (AWS, GCP)
Knowledge of Python/R languages
Knowledge of Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager
Experience with Spark
Demonstrated ability to solve hard mathematical, algorithmic, and statistical problems.
Significant accomplishments that required both technical and strategic capabilities, such as research projects, open-source software contributions, and entrepreneurship
What We Offer:
The opportunity to build a career of value and witness first hand the impact Prodigy has as the most engaging math platform in the world!
A culture of transparency, where team members are involved in important conversations
No micromanaging here! We believe in our employees skills and abilities, we encourage you to bring new innovative ideas to your team
Full health benefits from day one (1) for you and your family, fully covered! Nothing is ever taken off your pay cheque
We are a profitable company, with eligibility to participate in stock options for all employees

Late or early riser? We understand! We offer flexible working hours that allow you to schedule your 8 hour day with a bit more flexibility. We do have core office hours, to ensure team members can be present for important meetings and department needs. Our core office hours are 10:30am - 3:00pm
<div>
While we operate 100% remotely for the time being, our company culture and values remain at the core of everything we do. We are offering a number of remote-friendly activities such as:
Virtual trivia
Zoom meditation, stretching, and fitness sessions
Daily remote challenges via Slack
Virtual “Prodigy Prepares” cooking series featuring our very own employees!
Remote work employee budget for things like home office equipment etc.
<div>
When this pandemic comes to an end and it is safe to be back in the office here's a glimpse into what you can expect:
Feel like a different work environment? Work from home 1x a week!
Team building events that not only include you as a Prodigy employee, but your significant other and children as well
Company pizza lunch every second week for ‘All Hands’, where we discuss important Prodigy milestones
Do you need some fun to help break up your day? We have that covered! Join in some Ping Pong games, Smash Bros competitions or board games!
Come as you are
<div>

We believe the power of our collective potential will transform education. We are building towards a diverse, inclusive, and equitable workplace to empower and create access and opportunity for all. We welcome applications from people from all underrepresented groups, including (but not limited to) people of any gender, age, or religion, members of the LGBTQIA2+ community, BIPOC and other underrepresented races and nationalities, people with disabilities, veterans, and anyone who may contribute to the further diversification of Prodigy Education.
If you feel like you don’t have all the qualifications for this position, and are willing to use your initiative to learn the rest, we’d still love for you to apply!
<div>

We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 (AODA). <b>Job Posting Description:

Do you want to be an integral part of the LCBO’s exciting transformation to drive the PMO Financial Management to maturity and build trusted partnerships within many integral areas of the business? Reporting to the Manager, IT Financial Planning you will improve organization performance and achieve portfolio goals by defining and executing end-to-end project financial management processes. You will proactively manage and report on the financials for project deliverables and communicate with multiple stakeholders to align priorities and direction. You will track the financial health of the IT portfolios, programs and projects, and ensure governance, processes and standards are being adhered to.

Are you an innovative, data driven professional, who loves to challenge the status quo with natural problem solving abilities? If you are motivated to simplify, streamline, and equip leaders/partners alike with the data and/or tools required to make intelligent business decisions, then this role is for you!
About the Role:
Project Tracking and Reporting

• Create dashboards/visualizations/reports with BI tools (i.e. Power BI, SAP Analytics Cloud, Excel), query various database systems to create new data/financial models, and maintain reports and conduct analysis to ensure data quality
• Generate, update, analyze and present financial plans including period rolling forecasts, the latest estimates, baselines and cost benefit analyses

• Capture and summarize project data utilizing Oracle Financials, Microstrategy, MS Project Online to build portfolio level reports and dashboards for senior management, and build/maintain a Resource Capacity/Demand Management Report
• Summarize and present to leadership the current state of the projects, programs and/or portfolio financials vs. planned, and provide valuable insights to enable decisions by leadership
Governance and Control
• Lead the development, implementation and ongoing monitoring of project, program and portfolio controls for cost, performance indicators, and audit/quality assurance
• Manage financial governance of projects to ensure compliance with LCBO’s organizational PMO mandate, by manually conducting quality checks and/or building automated controls
• Develop and assess project management financial templates and make recommendations for improvements to existing templates, cultivating a continuous improvement culture in project management
• Ensure quality and accuracy of financial data in Project Online and SharePoint and confirm change control is executed throughout the project/program lifecycle
Application Administration and Support
• Support custom configuration, updates and suggested improvements to Oracle financials, MS Project Online, PMO SharePoint sites (i.e. automated workflows, new power app)
• Provide administrative support to end users for Oracle financials MS Project Online and SharePoint sites
Training and Support
• Conduct project management financial knowledge sessions and/or coordinate workshops to elevate PMO proficiencies, and raise PMO knowledge and awareness on best practices
• Onboard, train and coach new Project Managers on LCBO project financial management, processes and governance
About You:
• Post-secondary education required and/or 10 years of equivalent work experience
• Professional accounting designation (or currently working towards)
• 5+ years working in data analysis and financial and/or PMO reporting (i.e. metric reporting, financial forecasting, variance analysis)
• Advanced knowledge of Excel and SQL
• Solid understanding of BI tools (i.e. Power BI, OBIEE, Microstrategy), SAP Analytics Cloud, Project Online and MS office suite
• Knowledge of Project Management practices and principals, as well as System Development Methodologies (i.e. Waterfall, Agile) considered an asset
• Knowledge of techniques for budgeting, project estimation, planning and controls
• Process mapping experience considered an asset
• Demonstrated experience in influencing others

Who We Are

,

Vigorate Digital is made up of a team of people. Each of us is driven by a passion to create digital experiences that will build strong one-to-one relationships. Smart. Curious. Engaged. Fun. Problem solvers.

,

Vigorate Digital focusses on the concept of enabling our clients strategic marketing goals, leveraging the most recognized industry-leading software platforms, like Salesforce Marketing Cloud.

,

We’re one of the fastest growing marketing service providers in Canada because we work hard to establish and grow long-term relationships with our clients. Our collaborative, flexible business model ensures that we structure every relationship around our clients’ success.

,

We work directly with brand marketers and their agencies across all verticals, providing the strategic leadership and execution support that are required to maximize the power of the marketing cloud technologies today’s marketers are investing in.

,

The Opportunity

,

As a Marketing Database Analyst with Vigorate Digital, you will be our thought leader for our data products and services, with a focus on Salesforce data products including Datorama, Interaction Studio, Marketing Cloud reporting and other visualization tools such as Tableau.

,

This is both a strategic and executional role that will be responsible for working with our digital marketing clients, account management and pre-sales staff as well as our technical staff to define, develop, and deploy Services and Solutions centered around our emerging data practice.

,

You will develop strategies and plans for developing reporting and QBR standards, data visualization processes, managing integrations with partners, and working with our client’s brand teams to define appropriate digital audiences. You will also be the primary contact for our clients to ensure audiences and messaging are being effectively delivered, and are being appropriately measured.

About Us

,

The Simply Group is a family of companies sharing common values, interests, and practices to deliver energy efficient residential and commercial solutions so Canadians never have to sacrifice comfort or quality for essential services. With steady year-over-year growth and over $1.25 billion in rental assets, Simply Group is one of Canada's leaders in whole-home comfort. Our team of over 240 employees take an innovative approach to offer a comprehensive source of solutions that improve the status quo for ourselves, our communities and our clients. We are committed to making things better for everyone and advancing the careers of all our employees.

,

Simply Group serves customers across Canada through multiple brands. Our companies are divided into four categories
column2:

,

We are looking for a self-driven Business Analyst to join the Product team as Simply. You will support our growing team to help launch new programs and product improvements that will drive incremental revenue for multiple business channels. We are seeking a Business Systems Analyst to develop and refine enhancement solutions within our ERP platform working closely with our external technology partners, head office, and store staff.

,

This is a part-time role (20 hours a week) with a growing company in a stable industry. We provide a competitive salary, comprehensive health and dental benefits, and two weeks of annual vacation.

,

The Business Systems Analyst will provide services in all areas of application and reporting development work, including business requirements, analysis, and design, programming, testing, documentation, and deployment. In addition, you will provide effective and timely response to business needs, taking a lead role in detecting and resolving associated technical issues and problems.

,

Primary Responsibilities

,

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

,
  • Develop a strong understanding of installed systems and technology options.
  • Work closely with stakeholders to determine enhancements and solutions, assessing the impact to existing work processes and systems, and pinpoint how to manage integration.
  • Assist in translating requirements and user cases into test conditions and expected results for product, performance, user acceptance, and operational acceptance testing.
  • Provide operational and process-related analysis and support frequently presenting and explaining system design, process/data charts to obtain business input or buy-in.
  • Manage projects to ensure the availability of scarce resources and on-time delivery of projects by holding vendors and internal resources accountable to timelines.
  • Communicating with other teams to resolve issues or implement change control, if required.
  • Work as a team member in a fast-paced, Agile environment.
  • Have the ability to analyze and troubleshoot problems remotely.
  • Support Company’s Vision, Mission, and Core Values.
  • Other duties as assigned from time to time.
,

· Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or a related discipline with 5 years’ experience.
· Minimum 4+ years of BSA experience.
· Flexibility to operate within an Iterative, Agile or Waterfall project methodologies.
· Comprehension of data and database concepts including, the ability to interpret data dictionaries, creation and interpretation of Entity-Relationship Diagrams, working knowledge of data maps, data diagrams/structure.
· Experience with Capability Maturity ModelIntegration (CMMI) and Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC).
· Ability to research and investigates defects/issues related to requirements/specifications.
· Experience working with third-party vendors to ensure delivery of projects under strict time and costs constraints.

Scope of Position

The Senior Business Analyst will assist in the preparation of reports summarizing the monthly business results and preparing specific analysis comparing the actual results to the annual Plan. In addition, the Senior Business Analyst will assist in the preparation and analysis of the annual Plan and quarterly Outlooks. While functionally reporting to the Business Controller, the Senior Business Analyst will work directly with the Business Directors and other operational staff to gain insight into the key business drivers for each business and help identify the impact of these key business drivers on results and forward looking data.
What you need to be successful
University Degree in Business, Accounting or related required.
Accounting Designation (CA/CPA/CMA/CGA) highly preferred.

We are seeking a Business Systems Analyst to develop and refine enhancement solutions within our ERP platform working closely with our external technology partners, head office, and store staff.

,

This is a part-time role (20 hours a week) with a growing company in a stable industry. We provide a competitive salary, comprehensive health and dental benefits, and two weeks of annual vacation.

,

The Business Systems Analyst will provide services in all areas of application and reporting development work, including business requirements, analysis, and design, programming, testing, documentation, and deployment. In addition, you will provide effective and timely response to business needs, taking a lead role in detecting and resolving associated technical issues and problems.

,

Primary Responsibilities

,

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

,
  • Develop a strong understanding of installed systems and technology options.
  • Work closely with stakeholders to determine enhancements and solutions, assessing the impact to existing work processes and systems, and pinpoint how to manage integration.
  • Assist in translating requirements and user cases into test conditions and expected results for product, performance, user acceptance, and operational acceptance testing.
  • Provide operational and process-related analysis and support frequently presenting and explaining system design, process/data charts to obtain business input or buy-in.
  • Manage projects to ensure the availability of scarce resources and on-time delivery of projects by holding vendors and internal resources accountable to timelines.
  • Communicating with other teams to resolve issues or implement change control, if required.
  • Work as a team member in a fast-paced, Agile environment.
  • Have the ability to analyze and troubleshoot problems remotely.
  • Support Company’s Vision, Mission, and Core Values.
  • Other duties as assigned from time to time.
,

Requirements
· Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or a related discipline with 5 years’ experience.
· Minimum 4+ years of BSA experience.
· Flexibility to operate within an Iterative, Agile or Waterfall project methodologies.
· Comprehension of data and database concepts including, the ability to interpret data dictionaries, creation and interpretation of Entity-Relationship Diagrams, working knowledge of data maps, data diagrams/structure.
· Experience with Capability Maturity ModelIntegration (CMMI) and Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC).
· Ability to research and investigates defects/issues related to requirements/specifications.
· Experience working with third-party vendors to ensure delivery of projects under strict time and costs constraints.
· Understanding of ERP systems, Java, APIs at a conceptual level
· CCBA or CBAP Understands software quality assurance testing concepts and techniques (asset)

,

Prodigy Education connects students, parents, teachers and school districts with resources that promote a lifelong love of learning. Anyone with an internet connection is welcome to create a free account and try the most effective and engaging K-8 math platform in the world. Our business model helps us connect with youth around the world, with over 100 million students now voluntarily practicing math every single day — and enjoying it!

At Prodigy Education, we have an incredible team that works tirelessly to turn our goal of making education a human right into a reality. We are immensely grateful for our amazing team and all they do every day. We welcome people who share our passion to join our team, where you will have the opportunity to help an entire generation of students to LOVE learning.
<div><i>
Our passion is our mission - to help every student in the world love learning!
<div>
Please note: During the Covid-19 pandemic, in order to keep all our candidates safe, Prodigy is hiring and on-boarding 100% remotely for the time being.
Overview:

Our data and marketing teams are scaling rapidly as we continue to hit our product and growth milestones! The work you do here will aid the educational advancement of millions of students. You will have the chance to apply your analytics skills to not only help kids learn but also help our marketing team to make better decisions.

We are looking for a marketing data analytics expert to join our growing team. As we scale our marketing efforts, the team will be looking to you for insights on the effectiveness of initiatives, and opportunities for optimization and growth. You will have the chance to apply your marketing analytics expertise to add real strategic value and ensure that we are asking and answering the right questions.
Your Impact:
Collaborate with data analysts, data scientists, data engineers, and team leads to create solutions which will directly affect Prodigy’s growth
Help our marketing team explore, analyze, and understand their data to help marketing make channel investment decisions
Improve data visibility by building dashboards and charts to inform strategy, and capture market and user insights
Benchmark performance across all channels and inform campaign optimization based on performance analysis
Work with the marketing and data teams to improve data quality to provide high quality insights and recommendations
Help design, execute, and evaluate experiments (e.g., A/A, A/B, multivariate tests etc)
Communicate insights, analysis, and recommendations clearly and accurately to stakeholders with a variety of technical and non-technical backgrounds.
Who You Are:
At least 2 years demonstrated analytics experience
Expert skills and knowledge of SQL
Expertise in working with various BI platforms (Tableau, Looker, Periscope)
Experience working with A/B testing and experimentation
Experience in marketing analytics
Ability to work simultaneously on different projects with a variety of timelines
Ability to translate data insights into actionable steps
A team and customer centric mindset
Love for our mission of helping kids everywhere enjoy learning
Bonus Points For:
Experience in cloud ecosystems and their data tooling (AWS, GCP)
Knowledge of Python/R languages
Knowledge of Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager
Experience with Spark
Demonstrated ability to solve hard mathematical, algorithmic, and statistical problems.
Significant accomplishments that required both technical and strategic capabilities, such as research projects, open-source software contributions, and entrepreneurship
What We Offer:
The opportunity to build a career of value and witness first hand the impact Prodigy has as the most engaging math platform in the world!
A culture of transparency, where team members are involved in important conversations
No micromanaging here! We believe in our employees skills and abilities, we encourage you to bring new innovative ideas to your team
Full health benefits from day one (1) for you and your family, fully covered! Nothing is ever taken off your pay cheque
We are a profitable company, with eligibility to participate in stock options for all employees

Late or early riser? We understand! We offer flexible working hours that allow you to schedule your 8 hour day with a bit more flexibility. We do have core office hours, to ensure team members can be present for important meetings and department needs. Our core office hours are 10:30am - 3:00pm
<div>
While we operate 100% remotely for the time being, our company culture and values remain at the core of everything we do. We are offering a number of remote-friendly activities such as:
Virtual trivia
Zoom meditation, stretching, and fitness sessions
Daily remote challenges via Slack
Virtual “Prodigy Prepares” cooking series featuring our very own employees!
Remote work employee budget for things like home office equipment etc.
<div>
When this pandemic comes to an end and it is safe to be back in the office here's a glimpse into what you can expect:
Feel like a different work environment? Work from home 1x a week!
Team building events that not only include you as a Prodigy employee, but your significant other and children as well
Company pizza lunch every second week for ‘All Hands’, where we discuss important Prodigy milestones
Do you need some fun to help break up your day? We have that covered! Join in some Ping Pong games, Smash Bros competitions or board games!
Come as you are
<div>

We believe the power of our collective potential will transform education. We are building towards a diverse, inclusive, and equitable workplace to empower and create access and opportunity for all. We welcome applications from people from all underrepresented groups, including (but not limited to) people of any gender, age, or religion, members of the LGBTQIA2+ community, BIPOC and other underrepresented races and nationalities, people with disabilities, veterans, and anyone who may contribute to the further diversification of Prodigy Education.
If you feel like you don’t have all the qualifications for this position, and are willing to use your initiative to learn the rest, we’d still love for you to apply!
<div>

We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 (AODA). Prodigy Game will provide accommodations to job applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment process. If you require an accommodation, please notify us and we will work with you to meet your needs.]]"

Scope of Position

The Senior Business Analyst will assist in the preparation of reports summarizing the monthly business results and preparing specific analysis comparing the actual results to the annual Plan. In addition, the Senior Business Analyst will assist in the preparation and analysis of the annual Plan and quarterly Outlooks. While functionally reporting to the Business Controller, the Senior Business Analyst will work directly with the Business Directors and other operational staff to gain insight into the key business drivers for each business and help identify the impact of these key business drivers on results and forward looking data.
What you need to be successful
University Degree in Business, Accounting or related required.
Accounting Designation (CA/CPA/CMA/CGA) highly preferred.
5-10 years of financial experience preferably in a multi-site manufacturing environment.
Exceptional MS Office and accounting software knowledge (SAP an Asset).
Strong verbal and written communication skills, initiative and ability to multi-task.
Good time management skills, enabling completion of responsibilities within deadlines.
Excellent communication and writing skills.
Strong Interpersonal and Teamwork skills and also able to work independently.
Detail Oriented with strong analytical skills.
What you’ll be doing
Key responsibilities of this position include:
MONTH END CLOSE – 15%
Responsible for the timely and accurate month-end margin close for assigned product businesses (including posting entries).
• Responsible for ensuring that the Profit &
column2: Loss statements are accurate and conform to accounting principles.

column1: Identify process improvement opportunities.
MONTH END ANALYSIS AND SUPPORT – 35%
Prepare monthly and quarterly reports which highlight and explain significant variances between actual results and plan for assigned product businesses.
Prepare specific analysis and explanations versus plan including: sales, supply and production volume variance analysis
column3: third party supply cost variance analysis
column5: logistics (freight, tank car / tank truck and depot cost) variance analysis

column1: Prepare quarterly presentation files for Senior Management summarizing results and key variances.
ANNUAL PLAN &amp
Lead and prepare the Annual Plan &amp
column2: Quarterly Outlook for assigned product businesses. This includes working with Business Directors, Sales, Operations, and other key stakeholders to collect and analyze data to pull together the forward looking data.

Opta Information Intelligence Corp.
Data Analyst
Job Description Summary:
Job Description:

The Data Analyst will be a key contributor to Opta’s big data and AI expertise. The incumbent will be responsible for building, analyzing, and reporting on large and sample data assets. Using their strong statistical techniques, they will apply the right analysis strategy to deliver insight, relationships and repeatable queries or processes. Working closely with Product, Sales, R&
column2: D, IT and Professional Services, the individual will be responsible for analyzing complex data sets and the fulfillment of customer requests with an eye to business value and quality. The individual will work closely with Business Analysts to articulate production system requirements for Opta’s data assets, and with IT, Operations, Professional Services, and R&amp
column3: D to deliver and optimize analytical products and solutions. In addition, the individual will be responsible for augmenting Opta’s data assets with additional open data sources that support Opta’s data driven strategies and financial objectives.

column1: Accuracy and attention to detail is critically important. The incumbent will utilize multiple technical tools on a daily basis, including SQL, Excel, Hadoop, and other similar related data management tools, as well as tools to build on data-mining and predictive analytics logic. The incumbent must have the ability to assemble, extract, and illustrate meaningful insights from disparate Data Lake sources to drive actionable results.
Key Responsibilities:
• Prepare, coordinate and analyze customer data set and deliverables.
• Participate in the production and operations of analytics and reporting products and solutions, with responsibility for specific deliverables.
• Provide direct support to Sales partners in the development and conversion of pipeline opportunities
• Review existing data and current techniques to ensure integrity, and identify new data management and translation methods resulting in data integration improvements
• Maintain and improve data integrity and accuracy of assets, identifying ways to eliminate recurring data issues
• Articulate data requirements for production systems
• Load, validate, compile and analyze available data assets
• Produce reports based on business objectives and strategic requirements
• Assess market needs related to data and develop strategic options for data acquisition and product development
• Aid in the setup, process improvement and maturing of an analytics practice with in the organization
• Provide summary reporting to management on his/her ongoing work, analysis and projects
Education, knowledge and experience required:
• 3-5 years experience working in an entrepreneurial, fast-paced environment with cross functional teams
• Strong analytical and problem solving skills with the capability to look for solutions outside existing boundaries.
• Ability to navigate, construct and transform big data, data lakes and databases to create actionable insights.
• Adept at statistical analysis, trending and very detail oriented.
• Highly proficient in some of the following: Excel, SQL, Hadoop, R, SAS with a strong understanding of computer systems.
• Experience with Robotic Process Automation (RPA) tools strongly preferred
• Strong interpersonal skills and customer focus
• Written and oral fluency in English.
• Familiarity with data mining techniques, ETL practices and solutions within a Data Warehouse environment.
• Confident in creating and comprehending advanced spreadsheets, databases, data structures, etc.
• Experience effectively identifying (non-technical) user requirements, develop and execute a plan to deliver those requirements.

• Mortgage, banking or insurance industry knowledge would be an asset.

Position Description
CAMH Education is currently seeking a full-time, permanent Research Analyst reporting to the Manager, Simulation &amp
column2: Digital Innovation. The Research Analyst will support the research and evaluation activities of the CAMH Simulation Centre by preparing literature reviews, performing data collection, analysis and management, supporting ethics approval submissions, and contributing to publications and grant proposals. This position will also be involved in searching and critically reviewing literature including retrieving and synthesizing articles from the library and Internet, as well as establishing databases, entering/coding/scoring and analyzing data and participating in the preparation of presentations, publications, and documentation for various stakeholder groups. This position offers an exciting opportunity for a highly motivated, organized and hard-working individual with strong interpersonal and communication skills who will enjoy the challenge of working independently and within a team. The candidate will support a workplace that embraces diversity, encourages teamwork and complies with all applicable and legislative requirements. This position is located at 1001 Queen Street.

column1: Qualifications

The successful candidate will have an Honours Bachelor degree in the Education/Social Sciences/Health Sciences field combined with one year of related experience in educational research, ideally in a healthcare setting. Candidates will have demonstrated literature review and synthesis skills. Experience overseeing the data collection process and in database management is required. Demonstrated knowledge and understanding of qualitative and/or quantitative educational research methods is required, along with familiarity with relevant software for data analysis, particularly SPSS. Computer skills with knowledge and proficiency in Microsoft Office (including Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint), search engines and the ability to learn new applications is required. Candidates are required to be familiar with the application of simulation learning in healthcare settings. Demonstrated communication (oral/written) skills along with the ability for independent working and collaboration/teamwork are required. The candidate will have demonstrated organizational skills with the ability to meet deadlines. The ability to manage and adapt to diverse and dynamic work environments and conditions is essential. Candidates require the ability to work effectively with individuals from diverse backgrounds and working styles. Bilingualism (French/English) or proficiency in a second language would be an asset.
Please Note: This full-time, permanent position is part of the OPSEU Bargaining Unit.
Salary Range: $24.60 to $32.81 per hour
CAMH is a Tobacco-Free Organization.

At CAMH, we strive to be an equitable and inclusive employer. Our commitment to equity is grounded in an institution-wide commitment to achieving a working, teaching, and learning environment that is free of discrimination and harassment.

CAMH actively seeks candidates from First Nations, Métis and Inuit, racialized and LGBTQ2+ communities, women, and people with disabilities (including people who have experienced mental health and substance use challenges).
We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply to our positions.

The Simply Group is a family of companies sharing common values, interests, and practices to deliver energy efficient residential and commercial solutions so Canadians never have to sacrifice comfort or quality for essential services. 77,"Senior Program Manager, Mobility, Transportation and AI","Mississauga, ON",MaRS Discovery District,https://ca.indeed.com/rc/clk?jk=6891ea0b6b213a16&fccid=15579ffc463d1346&vjs=3,"[[

This role is about helping Canadian entrepreneurs launch, grow and scale world-beating companies in mobility and transportation, with a focus on AI-powered startup
<h2 class=""jobSectionHeader""><b>
About MaRS

MaRS Discovery District (@MaRSDD) in Toronto is the one of the world's largest urban innovation hubs. MaRS supports promising startups tackling key societal and industry challenges across Health, Cleantech, Fintech, Enterprise Software, Mobility, and Advanced Manufacturing. In addition to helping startups launch, grow and scale, the MaRS community is dedicated to cross-disciplinary collaboration, commercialization of discoveries and driving ideas to impact.

This role resides within the Venture Services group at MaRS. Venture Services works with over 1300 innovation-driven science and technology startups. Venture Services helps entrepreneurs commercialize innovations with high business growth potential in Canada and globally by facilitating access to the customer, talent, funding, marketing and stakeholder connections required to successfully scale their business.
<h2 class=""jobSectionHeader""><b>
Context

MaRS hosts the Toronto regional technology site for AVIN, a program designed to reinforce Ontario's position as a North American leader in transportation technology and infrastructure systems. Our program members work on products related to connected and autonomous vehicles (C/AVs) and intelligent transportation systems (ITS), all underpinned by artificial intelligence and machine learning. Solutions span autonomous vehicle perception and control systems, vehicle cybersecurity, electric vehicle infrastructure, real-time vehicle routing, automotive manufacturing defect prediction, and more.
<h2 class=""jobSectionHeader""><b>
About your Role

You will be responsible for managing the design, implementation, business development, and partnership development of the AVIN program and related initaitives that accelerate venture commercialization of Connected and Autonomous Vehicles and Intelligent Transportation Systems.
<h2 class=""jobSectionHeader""><b>
What You'll Be Doing
AVIN Program Delivery
Manage the AVIN Toronto Regional Technology Development Site (RTDS) by:
<ul>
• Design and run the ""MaRS Beta"" co-working space in the MaRS Centre for participating venture companies and partner organizations, working closely with the MaRS Real Estate team

• Onboarding and providing valuable business, technical, and legal advisory services to C/AV and ITS ventures, ensuring they receive appropriate and sufficient support and fully leverages appropriate MaRS resources.
• Managing the delivery and growth of an online product that provides a central location for sharing auto-tech datasets relevant to the venture companies and partner organizations.

• Creating thought leadership content and support startup community by designing and hosting multiple events on a quarterly basis relevant to the auto-tech sector in collaboration with the associated venture services.
AVIN Business and Partnership Development
<ul>
• Increase participating members in AVIN and fulfill contractual requirements
• Participate in speaking engagements and other activities to attract new C/AV and ITS ventures
• Conduct business development activities to acquire new program partners who provide key tools, resources and funding for the C/AV and ITS ventures, and manage partner
Funding Partner Liaison and AVIN Reporting
<ul>
• Key liaison between MaRS and our funding partner Ontario Centres of Excellence (OCE), representing MaRS at the OCE AVIN Hub and other AVIN regional sites
• Coordinate semi-annual surveys of participating venture companies

• Prepare detailed semi-annual reports in close collaboration with MaRS finance, tracking venture company progress, partner contributions and MaRS contributions towards the program, and program spending against budget.
• Represent Toronto RTDS provincially. Prepare monthly community reports for OCE / AVIN and quarterly or semi-annual community presentations.
Mobility/Transportation and Smart City Strategy
<ul>

• Contribute to MaRS' broader strategies for mobility/transportation and smart cities, including identifying opportunities and needs for future areas of investment, identifying and pursuing partnership opportunities with Business Development, and working with peers in Venture Services and Partner Solutions Group teams to design strategic initiatives in these areas
What You Bring
• Minimum undergraduate degree, preferably in Engineering, Computer Sciences, or Technology Degree, or Business or Program Management
• 5 – 7+ years experience in program/project management
• 5 – 7+ years experience in partnership development
• Familiarity with emerging next generation network technologies, including auto-tech, Artificial Intelligence, 5G, IoT, and Cloud Computing
• Ability to manage multiple large-scale and complex projects with contractual milestones
• Understanding of basic startup principles and stages
• Strong collaborator with excellent interpersonal skills
• Strong communication skills – oral, written and presentation
• Medium-high understanding of relevant technologies and applications / use cases, and passion/drive to proactively seek out and learn more
• Strong relationship management abilities, managing multiple stakeholders with minimal need for guidance
• Excellent organizational, multi-tasking and time management skills
• Experience with event planning and delivery
• Budget planning and management experience
• Professional demeanor, able to represent the organization in all circumstances
• Self-motivated and able to work independently or as a team member
• Strong customer focus
• Strategic thinker
Great to have (but not required)
<ul>
• 2 – 3+ years of experience in product development
• Experience working with one or more of the following industry areas: automotive, telecommunications, cybersecurity, artificial intelligence
• Experience supporting startups in an incubator/accelerator environment (or equivalent) as a support staff and/or advisor
• Experience preparing government reports and financial forecasts
• Deep technical or industry knowledge in automotive, or IoT, or AI communications and software
• Venture coaching experience
• Business Development experience
Applicants must be legally eligible to work in Canada and must currently be residing in Ontario.

MaRS Discovery District is committed to diversity and encourages applications from all qualified candidates, including aboriginal persons, francophones, members of sexual minority groups, persons with disabilities, visible minorities and women. We will provide any requested accommodation to candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process.

Applications are due by Thursday, December 17th, 2020 at 5:00 PM EST.

What you do at AMD changes everything

At AMD, we push the boundaries of what is possible. We believe in changing the world for the better by driving innovation in high-performance computing, graphics, and visualization technologies – building blocks for gaming, immersive platforms, and the data center.

Developing great technology takes more than talent: it takes amazing people who understand collaboration, respect, and who will go the “extra mile” to achieve unthinkable results. It takes people who have the passion and desire to disrupt the status quo, push boundaries, deliver innovation, and change the world. If you have this type of passion, we invite you to take a look at the opportunities available to come join our team.
Machine learning / High Performance Compute Program Manager

80,Data Analyst,"Mississauga, ON",SickKids,https://ca.indeed.com/rc/clk?jk=3c6941108ba1a044&fccid=9645047fb7b1d4e3&vjs=3,"[[

<div>

About SickKids
<div>

Dedicated exclusively to children and their families, The Hospital for Sick Children (SickKids) is one of the largest and most respected paediatric healthcare centres in the world. As innovators in child health, we lead and partner to improve the health of children through the integration of healthcare, leading-edge research and education. Our reputation would not have been built – nor could it be maintained – without the skills, knowledge and experience of the extraordinary people who come to work here every day. SickKids is committed to ongoing learning and development, and features a caring and supportive work environment that combines exceptionally high standards of practice.
When you join SickKids, you become part of our community. We share a commitment and determination to fulfill our vision of Healthier Children. A Better World.
Don’t miss out on the opportunity to work alongside the world’s best in paediatric healthcare.
Position Description
<div>

The Division of Paediatric Emergency Medicine (PEM) is recruiting a data analyst. This is an excellent opportunity for those interested in using their background in research design, statistics, and machine learning to impact healthcare delivery at scale. This position provides management and technical support for clinical researchers/research databases and applications by providing statistical/computational design and analysis support for randomized control trials and observational studies, generating reports to support clinical operations, and working with our clinicians and researchers directly to provide ad hoc data science services. It also involves leveraging SickKids health databases for the purpose of building and deploying novel machine learning models into clinical/research workflows.

This includes providing extensive analytic, research and client support as part of a team that delivers health care information and consulting services to hospital or research groups. The data analyst not only has accountability for significant support of Divisional data projects, but also supplements project management activities, provides input into the development of new business proposals, mentors junior staff, and assists with other on-going project work as needed.

The role is also responsible for supplying analytic expertise to service teams for the development and implementation of clinical, quantitative and statistical models, metrics and methods for hospital, research groups and other clinical groups.

The Emergency Department at SickKids is leading the nation on the development and deployment of innovative healthcare technologies and research. We encourage applicants with a strong statistics and computational background to apply.
Here’s What You’ll Get To Do:
Clinical Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning
• Utilize health databases for the development of novel machine learning algorithms
<li>Work with dedicated GPUs and the high-performance computing network at SickKids which is one of the top computational resources in any healthcare institution in Canada.

• Work with real-world healthcare data such as clinical notes, radiology images, and our point of care ultrasound databases to build NLP models, image classifiers, and semi-autonomous machine learning workflows
• Collaborate directly with the Artificial Intelligence in Medicine (AIM) group at SickKids led by Dr. Anna Goldenberg and be part of our growing SickKids machine learning community
<li>Work with clinicians and researchers throughout the entire machine learning project pipeline from use case design and data curation and processing to model training and deployment.
• Evaluate machine learning model impact and help construct future business cases to support ongoing resourcing and investment in new technology deployment
Research Analysis

• Provide analytic advice and support in protocol development/design and reporting of research studies with regards to proposed statistical analysis and sample size calculations s to research groups within PEM.
• Run descriptive statistics, regression analysis including survival analysis, categorical data analysis, applied Bayesian methods, predictive modelling, and applied machine learning.
• Advise on how to deal with missing data.
• Assess and communicate impact of novel research methodology / statistical approaches and educate internal staff as needed.
• Attend Research Council and New Project Rounds and provide analytic/statistical input for new protocols.
• Contribute to knowledge translation deliverables including interpretation of results, reports, technical memoranda, posters, presentations, and manuscripts.

• Direct more junior Research Analyst and Research Assistant staff to extract data from various sources to support the development of research proposals, project analysis plans, project specifications, and client deliverables.
• Oversee the organization and cleaning of research study data and facilitate decisions on archiving.
Databases Development, Queries and Maintenance
• Database configuration, development of web-based applications, tables and forms.
• Ensuring integrity and consistency of data in the databases.
• Developing data pipeline and processes to ensure databases remain up-to-date and synchronized with ongoing research study activities
• Documenting workflows and creating process flow charts.
• Interviewing stakeholders to determine custom database requirements.
• Identifying issues and gaps in databases.
<li>Facilitate the integration of new data sources into existing clinical/research databases
• Assisting with development of data dictionaries for new databases.
• Working with raw data and extracting data for research and machine learning purposes.
