You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You'll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you'll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.
Job Description:
Role Summary:

Canadian Operations is a diverse group of teams – each committed to creating exceptional experiences for our clients. Without a doubt, our clients lie at the forefront of everything we do. We partner closely with each Canadian business unit to deliver the most efficient and effective customer service through training, process improvements, and technology optimization. With over 3,000 employees, our team members work in offices across Canada, including Montreal, Ottawa, Toronto and Waterloo. We also partner with our Sun Life team members in the Asia Service Centre offices in India and the Philippines to deliver exceptional customer service.

As part of the BEAM (Business Excellence AI and Machine learning) team, the Senior Data Scientist will develop data science solutions for specific use cases identified in collaboration with other Operations teams. They will apply advanced machine learning and AI techniques to business problems, working closely with other data scientists and business partners. This role will report to the AVP, Data Science Strategy &amp
To be considered for this position, you are required to complete two steps in the application process. You will need to submit an online job application and complete an online assessment.
What will you do?
Play an active role in agile problem solving initiatives, collaborating within a cross-functional team of specialists:
Conduct end-to-end analysis that includes data gathering and requirements specification, processing, analysis, ongoing deliverables, and presentations.
Build and maintain strong working relationships with Operations teams and other BUs to ensure successful delivery of initiatives.
Research and source relevant data from internal business systems, external free and commercial data products
Apply machine learning and deep learning techniques to extract insights from available data
Extract actionable insights from unstructured datasets using advanced machine learning methods.
Use statistical methods to test findings through prototyping and scenario testing
Leverage business knowledge and judgement to prioritize approaches with a material financial impact
Establish model monitoring metrics and performance reporting format as appropriate to each use case
Collaborate with implementation teams to operationalize successful use cases
Make business recommendations with effective presentations of findings at multiple levels of stakeholders.
What do you need to succeed?
University degree in math, computer science, or other relevant fields. Graduate degrees preferred.
5+ years hands-on experience developing data science solutions in Python or R
Extensive knowledge of machine learning and deep learning tools and concepts such as autoencoders for outlier detection, sequence models, Shapley values, etc
Experience querying and manipulating data from relational databases and other data warehouse structures
Ability to maintain momentum on multiple projects in parallel and manage fluctuating deadlines and priorities
Demonstrated collaboration skills working in a team environment across multiple sites and multiple business units
Unique Requirements

The candidate selected for this role is required to have special clearance from the Royal Canadian Mounted Police. To see if you are eligible for this clearance, please review the section 201 on the Federal Government site (http://iss-ssi.pwgsc-tpsgc.gc.ca/msi-ism/ch2-prt1-eng.html)
What is in it for you?
Competitive salary and bonus structure influenced by market range data
Entitlement to flexible benefits and 4 weeks vacation
A friendly, collaborative and inclusive culture
Being part of our Analytics community, where we share best practices and broaden skill-sets
Interested in applying? Submit a job application by clicking “Apply” and complete an online assessment within 24 hours of submitting your job application using the link below.
Click on this link: https://apply.careerspark.com/j/xv9v0D6Jie36/l/JVxGM3OtFygF

to complete the online assessment after you submit your application. You will need to register with our partner Career Spark, using the same e-mail address used for your job application. If you complete this assessment before submitting your job application then you must return to this job posting again to complete your online job application by clicking “Apply”.
When a new position becomes available which matches your background and experience, the base pay range will be disclosed and correspond to the opportunity Sun Life will consider you for.

In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance. Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results.

Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.
Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.
We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

About MaRS

MaRS Discovery District (@MaRSDD) in Toronto is the one of the world's largest urban innovation hubs. MaRS supports promising startups tackling key societal and industry challenges across Health, Cleantech, Fintech, Enterprise Software, Mobility, and Advanced Manufacturing. In addition to helping startups launch, grow and scale, the MaRS community is dedicated to cross-disciplinary collaboration, commercialization of discoveries and driving ideas to impact.

This role resides within the Venture Services group at MaRS. Venture Services works with over 1300 innovation-driven science and technology startups. Venture Services helps entrepreneurs commercialize innovations with high business growth potential in Canada and globally by facilitating access to the customer, talent, funding, marketing and stakeholder connections required to successfully scale their business.
<h2 class=""jobSectionHeader""><b>
Context

MaRS hosts the Toronto regional technology site for AVIN, a program designed to reinforce Ontario's position as a North American leader in transportation technology and infrastructure systems. Our program members work on products related to connected and autonomous vehicles (C/AVs) and intelligent transportation systems (ITS), all underpinned by artificial intelligence and machine learning. Solutions span autonomous vehicle perception and control systems, vehicle cybersecurity, electric vehicle infrastructure, real-time vehicle routing, automotive manufacturing defect prediction, and more.
<h2 class=""jobSectionHeader""><b>
About your Role

You will be responsible for managing the design, implementation, business development, and partnership development of the AVIN program and related initaitives that accelerate venture commercialization of Connected and Autonomous Vehicles and Intelligent Transportation Systems.
<h2 class=""jobSectionHeader""><b>
What You'll Be Doing
AVIN Program Delivery
Manage the AVIN Toronto Regional Technology Development Site (RTDS) by:
<ul>
• Design and run the ""MaRS Beta"" co-working space in the MaRS Centre for participating venture companies and partner organizations, working closely with the MaRS Real Estate team

• Onboarding and providing valuable business, technical, and legal advisory services to C/AV and ITS ventures, ensuring they receive appropriate and sufficient support and fully leverages appropriate MaRS resources.
• Managing the delivery and growth of an online product that provides a central location for sharing auto-tech datasets relevant to the venture companies and partner organizations.

• Creating thought leadership content and support startup community by designing and hosting multiple events on a quarterly basis relevant to the auto-tech sector in collaboration with the associated venture services.
AVIN Business and Partnership Development
<ul>
• Increase participating members in AVIN and fulfill contractual requirements
• Participate in speaking engagements and other activities to attract new C/AV and ITS ventures
• Conduct business development activities to acquire new program partners who provide key tools, resources and funding for the C/AV and ITS ventures, and manage partner
Funding Partner Liaison and AVIN Reporting
<ul>
• Key liaison between MaRS and our funding partner Ontario Centres of Excellence (OCE), representing MaRS at the OCE AVIN Hub and other AVIN regional sites
• Coordinate semi-annual surveys of participating venture companies

• Prepare detailed semi-annual reports in close collaboration with MaRS finance, tracking venture company progress, partner contributions and MaRS contributions towards the program, and program spending against budget.
• Represent Toronto RTDS provincially. Prepare monthly community reports for OCE / AVIN and quarterly or semi-annual community presentations.
Mobility/Transportation and Smart City Strategy
<ul>

• Contribute to MaRS' broader strategies for mobility/transportation and smart cities, including identifying opportunities and needs for future areas of investment, identifying and pursuing partnership opportunities with Business Development, and working with peers in Venture Services and Partner Solutions Group teams to design strategic initiatives in these areas
What You Bring
• Minimum undergraduate degree, preferably in Engineering, Computer Sciences, or Technology Degree, or Business or Program Management
• 5 – 7+ years experience in program/project management
• 5 – 7+ years experience in partnership development
• Familiarity with emerging next generation network technologies, including auto-tech, Artificial Intelligence, 5G, IoT, and Cloud Computing
• Ability to manage multiple large-scale and complex projects with contractual milestones
• Understanding of basic startup principles and stages
• Strong collaborator with excellent interpersonal skills
• Strong communication skills – oral, written and presentation
• Medium-high understanding of relevant technologies and applications / use cases, and passion/drive to proactively seek out and learn more
• Strong relationship management abilities, managing multiple stakeholders with minimal need for guidance
• Excellent organizational, multi-tasking and time management skills
• Experience with event planning and delivery
• Budget planning and management experience
• Professional demeanor, able to represent the organization in all circumstances
• Self-motivated and able to work independently or as a team member
• Strong customer focus
• Strategic thinker
Great to have (but not required)
<ul>
• 2 – 3+ years of experience in product development
• Experience working with one or more of the following industry areas: automotive, telecommunications, cybersecurity, artificial intelligence
• Experience supporting startups in an incubator/accelerator environment (or equivalent) as a support staff and/or advisor
• Experience preparing government reports and financial forecasts
• Deep technical or industry knowledge in automotive, or IoT, or AI communications and software
• Venture coaching experience
• Business Development experience
Applicants must be legally eligible to work in Canada and must currently be residing in Ontario.

MaRS Discovery District is committed to diversity and encourages applications from all qualified candidates, including aboriginal persons, francophones, members of sexual minority groups, persons with disabilities, visible minorities and women. We will provide any requested accommodation to candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process.

Applications are due by Thursday, December 17th, 2020 at 5:00 PM EST.

,

93,Data Analyst,"Toronto, ON",SickKids,https://ca.indeed.com/rc/clk?jk=3c6941108ba1a044&fccid=9645047fb7b1d4e3&vjs=3,"[[

<div>
1
About SickKids
<div>

Dedicated exclusively to children and their families, The Hospital for Sick Children (SickKids) is one of the largest and most respected paediatric healthcare centres in the world. As innovators in child health, we lead and partner to improve the health of children through the integration of healthcare, leading-edge research and education. Our reputation would not have been built – nor could it be maintained – without the skills, knowledge and experience of the extraordinary people who come to work here every day. SickKids is committed to ongoing learning and development, and features a caring and supportive work environment that combines exceptionally high standards of practice.
When you join SickKids, you become part of our community. We share a commitment and determination to fulfill our vision of Healthier Children. A Better World.
Don’t miss out on the opportunity to work alongside the world’s best in paediatric healthcare.
Position Description
<div>

The Division of Paediatric Emergency Medicine (PEM) is recruiting a data analyst. This is an excellent opportunity for those interested in using their background in research design, statistics, and machine learning to impact healthcare delivery at scale. This position provides management and technical support for clinical researchers/research databases and applications by providing statistical/computational design and analysis support for randomized control trials and observational studies, generating reports to support clinical operations, and working with our clinicians and researchers directly to provide ad hoc data science services. It also involves leveraging SickKids health databases for the purpose of building and deploying novel machine learning models into clinical/research workflows.

This includes providing extensive analytic, research and client support as part of a team that delivers health care information and consulting services to hospital or research groups. The data analyst not only has accountability for significant support of Divisional data projects, but also supplements project management activities, provides input into the development of new business proposals, mentors junior staff, and assists with other on-going project work as needed.

The role is also responsible for supplying analytic expertise to service teams for the development and implementation of clinical, quantitative and statistical models, metrics and methods for hospital, research groups and other clinical groups.

The Emergency Department at SickKids is leading the nation on the development and deployment of innovative healthcare technologies and research. We encourage applicants with a strong statistics and computational background to apply.
Here’s What You’ll Get To Do:
Clinical Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning
• Utilize health databases for the development of novel machine learning algorithms
<li>Work with dedicated GPUs and the high-performance computing network at SickKids which is one of the top computational resources in any healthcare institution in Canada.

• Work with real-world healthcare data such as clinical notes, radiology images, and our point of care ultrasound databases to build NLP models, image classifiers, and semi-autonomous machine learning workflows
• Collaborate directly with the Artificial Intelligence in Medicine (AIM) group at SickKids led by Dr. Anna Goldenberg and be part of our growing SickKids machine learning community
<li>Work with clinicians and researchers throughout the entire machine learning project pipeline from use case design and data curation and processing to model training and deployment.
• Evaluate machine learning model impact and help construct future business cases to support ongoing resourcing and investment in new technology deployment
Research Analysis

• Provide analytic advice and support in protocol development/design and reporting of research studies with regards to proposed statistical analysis and sample size calculations s to research groups within PEM.
• Run descriptive statistics, regression analysis including survival analysis, categorical data analysis, applied Bayesian methods, predictive modelling, and applied machine learning.
• Advise on how to deal with missing data.
• Assess and communicate impact of novel research methodology / statistical approaches and educate internal staff as needed.
• Attend Research Council and New Project Rounds and provide analytic/statistical input for new protocols.
• Contribute to knowledge translation deliverables including interpretation of results, reports, technical memoranda, posters, presentations, and manuscripts.

• Direct more junior Research Analyst and Research Assistant staff to extract data from various sources to support the development of research proposals, project analysis plans, project specifications, and client deliverables.
• Oversee the organization and cleaning of research study data and facilitate decisions on archiving.
Databases Development, Queries and Maintenance
• Database configuration, development of web-based applications, tables and forms.
• Ensuring integrity and consistency of data in the databases.
• Developing data pipeline and processes to ensure databases remain up-to-date and synchronized with ongoing research study activities
• Documenting workflows and creating process flow charts.
• Interviewing stakeholders to determine custom database requirements.
• Identifying issues and gaps in databases.
<li>Facilitate the integration of new data sources into existing clinical/research databases
• Assisting with development of data dictionaries for new databases.
• Working with raw data and extracting data for research and machine learning purposes.
• Prepare stats for administrative reports.
Here’s What You’ll Need:
<li>Master’s degree with education in Computer Science and Statistics
• Understanding of various research methodologies and study designs
• Knowledge of MS Access
• SAS or other statistical package (e.g. python statistical libraries) and SQL Server
• Experience in a research in academic setting is preferred.
• Experience in interoperability is preferred.
• High level of sound judgment, business acumen, problem solving, diplomacy, and relationship building skills are necessary.
• High level of critical thinking, analytical and research skills are required to obtain information and provide creative and fundamentally sound recommendations on a variety of issues
• Exceptional communication skills – both written and verbal
• Exceptional communication skills with patients and families.
• Able to work effectively and influence at all levels in an organization, a team player and able to work with and through others
• Strong analytic and decision-making abilities
Employment Type: Permanent, Full-Time
Our Commitment to Diversity
<div>
The children and families we care for are diverse, and so are our employees. All are welcome to join our unique organizational culture and be part of our inclusive team.

If requested, SickKids is proud to make available accommodations to support applicants with disabilities during the interview and assessment process. Information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially. SickKids is also committed to providing services in both official languages and our preference is to hire employees who are fluent in both English and French whenever possible.

Thank you for your interest in joining SickKids. Only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted. In accordance with our Hospital policy, employment at SickKids is conditional upon the Hospital’s receipt of all necessary documentation.
How to Apply
Tip: Combine your cover letter and resume into ONE document of 20 pages or less as you cannot upload multiple documents as part of your application.

If you are still experiencing technical difficulties please email ask.hr@sickkids.ca to send us a short description of the issues you are experiencing. Please note that we will not accept resumes sent to this inbox but we are happy to respond to requests for technical assistance.

,

]]"

column1: Zynga’s data science and analytics team uses our unique and expansive data to model and predict user behavior, making our games more personalized and more fun to play! We strive for a better understanding of our players which translates into challenges and features that delight them and increased social engagement within our games.

Here’s where you would come in: identify and formalize problems to understand user behavior. Create systems and analyses to derive insights that change the studio’s world view. Be innovative, be creative, use every bit of that key commodity – data. Millions of people play Zynga games every day, so our data is tremendously rich and we have a lot of it!

We will rely on you to communicate your findings to your peers – both technical and non-technical. Your solutions to difficult problems will need to be demonstrably impactful, visual and maintainable. You will work with our game teams to put your models into production. You will collaborate with Product Managers, Game Designers, and Engineers to deliver business impact, changing current practices in line with new findings and insights.
<h2 class=""jobSectionHeader""><b>
Responsibilities:
• Work with large amounts of data to find opportunities to improve the experience that Zynga provides to its players
• Deliver analytics and data science projects that are aligned with the roadmap, and product goals - balancing actionable insights to substantially improve core game metrics
• Drive and empower game studio to make quantitatively informed, evidence based decisions through maintaining source of truth data sources and dashboards
• Work closely with game team to design, test, verify and implement machine learning models and product features with Zynga’s games that impact millions of users
Required Skills and Experience:
• BS in Computer Science, Math, Statistics, Economics, or other quantitative field
• 2+ years of work experience in data science or analytics roles
<li>Fluent in SQL
column2: Solid experience with programming in Python and/or R
column3: Adept in at least one visualization tool such as Tableau, or QlikView

column1: • Demonstrable experience with some or all of the following: statistics, experimental design, machine learning, deep learning
• Experience in analyzing large datasets, preferably in a Hadoop or Spark environment, and deploying production ready systems at scale
• Strong written and oral communication skills
• Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment with changing priorities
• Ability to collaborate effectively with engineers, product managers, analysts, and marketing to deliver unambiguous business impact
• Strong passion for gaming!

You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You'll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you'll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.
Job Description:
Role Summary:

Canadian Operations is a diverse group of teams – each committed to creating exceptional experiences for our clients. Without a doubt, our clients lie at the forefront of everything we do. We partner closely with each Canadian business unit to deliver the most efficient and effective customer service through training, process improvements, and technology optimization. With over 3,000 employees, our team members work in offices across Canada, including Montreal, Ottawa, Toronto and Waterloo. We also partner with our Sun Life team members in the Asia Service Centre offices in India and the Philippines to deliver exceptional customer service.

As part of the BEAM (Business Excellence AI and Machine learning) team, the Senior Data Scientist will develop data science solutions for specific use cases identified in collaboration with other Operations teams. They will apply advanced machine learning and AI techniques to business problems, working closely with other data scientists and business partners. This role will report to the AVP, Data Science Strategy &amp
To be considered for this position, you are required to complete two steps in the application process. You will need to submit an online job application and complete an online assessment.
What will you do?
Play an active role in agile problem solving initiatives, collaborating within a cross-functional team of specialists:
Conduct end-to-end analysis that includes data gathering and requirements specification, processing, analysis, ongoing deliverables, and presentations.
Build and maintain strong working relationships with Operations teams and other BUs to ensure successful delivery of initiatives.
Research and source relevant data from internal business systems, external free and commercial data products
Apply machine learning and deep learning techniques to extract insights from available data
Extract actionable insights from unstructured datasets using advanced machine learning methods.
Use statistical methods to test findings through prototyping and scenario testing
Leverage business knowledge and judgement to prioritize approaches with a material financial impact
Establish model monitoring metrics and performance reporting format as appropriate to each use case
Collaborate with implementation teams to operationalize successful use cases
Make business recommendations with effective presentations of findings at multiple levels of stakeholders.
What do you need to succeed?
University degree in math, computer science, or other relevant fields. Graduate degrees preferred.
5+ years hands-on experience developing data science solutions in Python or R
Extensive knowledge of machine learning and deep learning tools and concepts such as autoencoders for outlier detection, sequence models, Shapley values, etc
Experience querying and manipulating data from relational databases and other data warehouse structures
Ability to maintain momentum on multiple projects in parallel and manage fluctuating deadlines and priorities
Demonstrated collaboration skills working in a team environment across multiple sites and multiple business units
Unique Requirements

The candidate selected for this role is required to have special clearance from the Royal Canadian Mounted Police. To see if you are eligible for this clearance, please review the section 201 on the Federal Government site (http://iss-ssi.pwgsc-tpsgc.gc.ca/msi-ism/ch2-prt1-eng.html)
What is in it for you?
Competitive salary and bonus structure influenced by market range data
Entitlement to flexible benefits and 4 weeks vacation
A friendly, collaborative and inclusive culture
Being part of our Analytics community, where we share best practices and broaden skill-sets
Interested in applying? Submit a job application by clicking “Apply” and complete an online assessment within 24 hours of submitting your job application using the link below.
Click on this link: https://apply.careerspark.com/j/xv9v0D6Jie36/l/JVxGM3OtFygF

to complete the online assessment after you submit your application. You will need to register with our partner Career Spark, using the same e-mail address used for your job application. If you complete this assessment before submitting your job application then you must return to this job posting again to complete your online job application by clicking “Apply”.
When a new position becomes available which matches your background and experience, the base pay range will be disclosed and correspond to the opportunity Sun Life will consider you for.

In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance. Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results.

Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.
Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.
We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

What you do at AMD changes everything

At AMD, we push the boundaries of what is possible. We believe in changing the world for the better by driving innovation in high-performance computing, graphics, and visualization technologies – building blocks for gaming, immersive platforms, and the data center.

Developing great technology takes more than talent: it takes amazing people who understand collaboration, respect, and who will go the “extra mile” to achieve unthinkable results. It takes people who have the passion and desire to disrupt the status quo, push boundaries, deliver innovation, and change the world. If you have this type of passion, we invite you to take a look at the opportunities available to come join our team.
Machine learning / High Performance Compute Program Manager
The Role:

As program manager in AMD’s machine learning software engineering team, you will drive end-to-end delivery of leading-edge technology in high performance GPU-accelerated compute and machine learning for the Radeon Open Compute software stack. You will learn about how the power of open-source software can be applied to solve real-world problems. You will interact with product management, customers, software and hardware engineering teams, quality assurance and operations in a new and growing team.
The Person:

The successful candidate in this role will be a self-starter, upbeat, quick learner who is passionate about new technology in addition to being results-oriented and able to get things done. They will be able to resolve ambiguity and adapt to changes in a dynamic environment. Drawing on their engineering background and proven experience in delivering software, the ideal candidate will be an excellent communicator who can engage with key partners at all levels, from driving technical discussions to leading executive program reviews.

Work closely with engineering managers, software developers and product managers to drive multi-functional project planning and execution of multiple software development projects.

• Collaborate with multi-functional groups, including software, firmware and hardware teams, across AMD Radeon Technology Group through the product life cycle, from definition to successful delivery of releases.
  • Dive deep into technical aspects of the program: resolve cross team dependencies and coordinate cross-team initiatives between software development teams.
  • Lead across several functional organizations, including business units, other engineering organizations, and finance/operations.

106,Data Analyst,"Waterloo, ON",SickKids,https://ca.indeed.com/rc/clk?jk=3c6941108ba1a044&fccid=9645047fb7b1d4e3&vjs=3,"[[

About SickKids
<div>

Dedicated exclusively to children and their families, The Hospital for Sick Children (SickKids) is one of the largest and most respected paediatric healthcare centres in the world. As innovators in child health, we lead and partner to improve the health of children through the integration of healthcare, leading-edge research and education. Our reputation would not have been built – nor could it be maintained – without the skills, knowledge and experience of the extraordinary people who come to work here every day. SickKids is committed to ongoing learning and development, and features a caring and supportive work environment that combines exceptionally high standards of practice.
When you join SickKids, you become part of our community. We share a commitment and determination to fulfill our vision of Healthier Children. A Better World.
Don’t miss out on the opportunity to work alongside the world’s best in paediatric healthcare.
Position Description
<div>

The Division of Paediatric Emergency Medicine (PEM) is recruiting a data analyst. This is an excellent opportunity for those interested in using their background in research design, statistics, and machine learning to impact healthcare delivery at scale. This position provides management and technical support for clinical researchers/research databases and applications by providing statistical/computational design and analysis support for randomized control trials and observational studies, generating reports to support clinical operations, and working with our clinicians and researchers directly to provide ad hoc data science services. It also involves leveraging SickKids health databases for the purpose of building and deploying novel machine learning models into clinical/research workflows.

This includes providing extensive analytic, research and client support as part of a team that delivers health care information and consulting services to hospital or research groups. The data analyst not only has accountability for significant support of Divisional data projects, but also supplements project management activities, provides input into the development of new business proposals, mentors junior staff, and assists with other on-going project work as needed.

The role is also responsible for supplying analytic expertise to service teams for the development and implementation of clinical, quantitative and statistical models, metrics and methods for hospital, research groups and other clinical groups.

The Emergency Department at SickKids is leading the nation on the development and deployment of innovative healthcare technologies and research. We encourage applicants with a strong statistics and computational background to apply.
Here’s What You’ll Get To Do:
Clinical Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning
• Utilize health databases for the development of novel machine learning algorithms
<li>Work with dedicated GPUs and the high-performance computing network at SickKids which is one of the top computational resources in any healthcare institution in Canada.

• Work with real-world healthcare data such as clinical notes, radiology images, and our point of care ultrasound databases to build NLP models, image classifiers, and semi-autonomous machine learning workflows
• Collaborate directly with the Artificial Intelligence in Medicine (AIM) group at SickKids led by Dr. Anna Goldenberg and be part of our growing SickKids machine learning community
<li>Work with clinicians and researchers throughout the entire machine learning project pipeline from use case design and data curation and processing to model training and deployment.
• Evaluate machine learning model impact and help construct future business cases to support ongoing resourcing and investment in new technology deployment
Research Analysis

• Provide analytic advice and support in protocol development/design and reporting of research studies with regards to proposed statistical analysis and sample size calculations s to research groups within PEM.
• Run descriptive statistics, regression analysis including survival analysis, categorical data analysis, applied Bayesian methods, predictive modelling, and applied machine learning.
• Advise on how to deal with missing data.
• Assess and communicate impact of novel research methodology / statistical approaches and educate internal staff as needed.
• Attend Research Council and New Project Rounds and provide analytic/statistical input for new protocols.
• Contribute to knowledge translation deliverables including interpretation of results, reports, technical memoranda, posters, presentations, and manuscripts.

• Direct more junior Research Analyst and Research Assistant staff to extract data from various sources to support the development of research proposals, project analysis plans, project specifications, and client deliverables.
• Oversee the organization and cleaning of research study data and facilitate decisions on archiving.
Databases Development, Queries and Maintenance
• Database configuration, development of web-based applications, tables and forms.
• Ensuring integrity and consistency of data in the databases.
• Developing data pipeline and processes to ensure databases remain up-to-date and synchronized with ongoing research study activities
• Documenting workflows and creating process flow charts.
• Interviewing stakeholders to determine custom database requirements.
• Identifying issues and gaps in databases.
<li>Facilitate the integration of new data sources into existing clinical/research databases
• Assisting with development of data dictionaries for new databases.
• Working with raw data and extracting data for research and machine learning purposes.
• Prepare stats for administrative reports.
Here’s What You’ll Need:
<li>Master’s degree with education in Computer Science and Statistics
• Understanding of various research methodologies and study designs
• Knowledge of MS Access
• SAS or other statistical package (e.g. python statistical libraries) and SQL Server
• Experience in a research in academic setting is preferred.
• Experience in interoperability is preferred.
• High level of sound judgment, business acumen, problem solving, diplomacy, and relationship building skills are necessary.
• High level of critical thinking, analytical and research skills are required to obtain information and provide creative and fundamentally sound recommendations on a variety of issues
• Exceptional communication skills – both written and verbal
• Exceptional communication skills with patients and families.
• Able to work effectively and influence at all levels in an organization, a team player and able to work with and through others
• Strong analytic and decision-making abilities
Employment Type: Permanent, Full-Time
Our Commitment to Diversity
<div>
The children and families we care for are diverse, and so are our employees. All are welcome to join our unique organizational culture and be part of our inclusive team.

If requested, SickKids is proud to make available accommodations to support applicants with disabilities during the interview and assessment process. Information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially. SickKids is also committed to providing services in both official languages and our preference is to hire employees who are fluent in both English and French whenever possible.

Thank you for your interest in joining SickKids. Only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted. In accordance with our Hospital policy, employment at SickKids is conditional upon the Hospital’s receipt of all necessary documentation.
How to Apply
Tip: Combine your cover letter and resume into ONE document of 20 pages or less as you cannot upload multiple documents as part of your application.

If you are still experiencing technical difficulties please email ask.hr@sickkids.ca to send us a short description of the issues you are experiencing. Please note that we will not accept resumes sent to this inbox but we are happy to respond to requests for technical assistance.

,

]]"

We are:

Talent and Organization, and we help clients co-create the workforce of the future. How? We make decisions based on insights. We give people the tools and roadmaps to do their best work. We create digital experiences employees love. And we teach companies how to grow great, forward-thinking leaders. Our approach and our people put us at the front of the pack for talent, HR and organizational consulting. We help clients with new skilling, talent strategy, leadership development, employee experience, change management and beyond. Visit us here to find out more about Talent and Organization.

You are:
<div>

A force for change. You know that companies must change or be left behind, and you know how to help companies do that. You’ve got the skills, tools and know-how to help companies remake themselves from top-to-bottom to be more nimble, more capable, and more productive.
<div>

An expert workplace educator. You know all the different ways that people learn. And you can pick and choose from the latest techniques and tools to help companies help their employees do their best. You’re more than just a learning specialist though. You’re also able to help companies choose the best way to approach learning on the job so they can transform their companies into digital powerhouses.
<div>
The work:

column1: Zynga’s data science and analytics team uses our unique and expansive data to model and predict user behavior, making our games more personalized and more fun to play! We strive for a better understanding of our players which translates into challenges and features that delight them and increased social engagement within our games.

Here’s where you would come in: identify and formalize problems to understand user behavior. Create systems and analyses to derive insights that change the studio’s world view. Be innovative, be creative, use every bit of that key commodity – data. Millions of people play Zynga games every day, so our data is tremendously rich and we have a lot of it!

We will rely on you to communicate your findings to your peers – both technical and non-technical. Your solutions to difficult problems will need to be demonstrably impactful, visual and maintainable. You will work with our game teams to put your models into production. You will collaborate with Product Managers, Game Designers, and Engineers to deliver business impact, changing current practices in line with new findings and insights.
<h2 class=""jobSectionHeader""><b>
Responsibilities:
• Work with large amounts of data to find opportunities to improve the experience that Zynga provides to its players
• Deliver analytics and data science projects that are aligned with the roadmap, and product goals - balancing actionable insights to substantially improve core game metrics
• Drive and empower game studio to make quantitatively informed, evidence based decisions through maintaining source of truth data sources and dashboards
• Work closely with game team to design, test, verify and implement machine learning models and product features with Zynga’s games that impact millions of users
Required Skills and Experience:
• BS in Computer Science, Math, Statistics, Economics, or other quantitative field
• 2+ years of work experience in data science or analytics roles

Bring us your passion for digital or data analytics, and we’ll put you to work on exciting initiatives that answer the challenge: ""How can we do that better?” Working with a dedicated team of energetic, forward-thinking innovators, you’ll stretch your imagination and sharpen your skills on the leading-edge projects that are keeping Sun Life Financial ahead of the curve. You want more than a job
column2: you want a career - a career with a company that encourages learning and personal growth. You want to be “one of the best”.

column1: Job Description:

Client Experience Office (CXO) aims to provide a holistic ""One Sun Life"" experience to Clients as we help them achieve lifetime financial security and live healthier lives. We design and execute clear, compelling, caring journeys to help Clients navigate some of the most important moments of their lives.

Through personalized, proactive and relevant content, we act on a deep understanding of Client needs on a multitude of communication channels—so we can be there for Clients when and where they need us.

To understand our Clients, we actively listen and learn by employing experts in Client experience, engagement, marketing, strategy, and digital, data and analytics. Our Client Solutions Centre (CSC) engages directly with plan members to ensure they maximize the value of their benefit and retirement plans.
Role Summary

Reporting to the AVP, Data Science and Client Analytics, Client Experience Office, the Director, Data Science and Analytics will lead the creation, implementation and tracking of insights which support key initiatives in client-related analytics.

A key responsibility of this role is to develop and lead analytical components of the Lead Assignment Program which is underway to increase the throughput of the client acquisition funnel. Proven practical experience in this area is an important requirement for this role.
Ultimately, the Director, Data Science and Analytics will work closely with other leaders within the team to plan, prioritize, design and deliver data products to improve business outcomes.
What will you do?
Build and deploy data products on AWS or SAS analytics workbenches
Stitch together complex data sets to unlock insights and communicate the results to the senior leadership
Oversee and lead a group of data professionals, which supports all initiatives related to Assignment and Matching
Design, build and deliver the lead assignment and corresponding recommendation / matching engines, including the evolution of Smart Lead Assignment
Develop metrics and KPIs to measure the performance of analytical and data products in the overall portfolio
Manage/communicate progress and roadmap of the related projects within the Assignment and Matching portfolio.
Build and maintain strong working relationships with BUs, Operations, IT, and other cross-functional partners to ensure timely and high impact execution of initiatives within the area.
What will you need to succeed?
Over eight years of data analytics experience, with a minimum of two years in a client facing or management role.
Master degree in Physics, Computer Science, or Engineering would be preferred.

Financial services industry experience is preferred (but not essential), including an understanding of domain-specific operational management practices and objectives, accountabilities, problem solving approaches, industry trends and best practices.
The successful candidate will have a strong passion for empirical research and for answering hard questions with data.
S/he understands analytics and machine learning techniques, including descriptive analytics and simulation, and modeling methods including supervised and unsupervised techniques.

The successful candidate will be a Strategic, Client Facing with strong written and oral communications skills who is able to influence the opinion of others. S/he will have demonstrated the ability to operate in a highly matrixed environment, influencing and leveraging resources that do not report to her/him directly, and possess strong interpersonal skills. As well, s/he will have excellent collaboration skills and will be very effective in working in a team environment and across multiple sites and business units.
Technical and Skills Requirements
Strong quantitative, analytical and technical skills
Strong quantitative background: Has impressive intellectual horsepower and well-versed in key quantitative and data-driven disciplines: statistics, mathematics and finance

Robust understanding of data sufficiency and hypothesis-driven approach: Knows how to formulate hypothesis, design and run controlled tests to be able to conclusively identify significance in results, proving or refuting hypothesis
Hands on experience of different data &
column2: analytics methodologies and tools, including SAS, Python, AWS, SageMaker and autonomous analytics (machine-learning)

column1: Proven experience in prescriptive analytics and machine learning
Design and architecture: Ability to conceptualize prescriptive analytics from identification of data requirements to design of solution
Delivery and results tracking: Experience in implementation of operational prescriptive analytics models, tracking of results and continuous improvement of model performance
What is in it for you?
Competitive salary and bonus structure influenced by market range data
A friendly, collaborative and inclusive culture
Being part of our Analytics community, where we share best practices and broaden skill-sets

You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You'll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you'll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.
Job Description:
Role Summary:

Canadian Operations is a diverse group of teams – each committed to creating exceptional experiences for our clients. Without a doubt, our clients lie at the forefront of everything we do. We partner closely with each Canadian business unit to deliver the most efficient and effective customer service through training, process improvements, and technology optimization. With over 3,000 employees, our team members work in offices across Canada, including Montreal, Ottawa, Toronto and Waterloo. We also partner with our Sun Life team members in the Asia Service Centre offices in India and the Philippines to deliver exceptional customer service.

As part of the BEAM (Business Excellence AI and Machine learning) team, the Senior Data Scientist will develop data science solutions for specific use cases identified in collaboration with other Operations teams. They will apply advanced machine learning and AI techniques to business problems, working closely with other data scientists and business partners. This role will report to the AVP, Data Science Strategy &amp
To be considered for this position, you are required to complete two steps in the application process. You will need to submit an online job application and complete an online assessment.
What will you do?
Play an active role in agile problem solving initiatives, collaborating within a cross-functional team of specialists:
Conduct end-to-end analysis that includes data gathering and requirements specification, processing, analysis, ongoing deliverables, and presentations.
Build and maintain strong working relationships with Operations teams and other BUs to ensure successful delivery of initiatives.
Research and source relevant data from internal business systems, external free and commercial data products
Apply machine learning and deep learning techniques to extract insights from available data
Extract actionable insights from unstructured datasets using advanced machine learning methods.
Use statistical methods to test findings through prototyping and scenario testing
Leverage business knowledge and judgement to prioritize approaches with a material financial impact
Establish model monitoring metrics and performance reporting format as appropriate to each use case
Collaborate with implementation teams to operationalize successful use cases
Make business recommendations with effective presentations of findings at multiple levels of stakeholders.
What do you need to succeed?
University degree in math, computer science, or other relevant fields. Graduate degrees preferred.
5+ years hands-on experience developing data science solutions in Python or R
Extensive knowledge of machine learning and deep learning tools and concepts such as autoencoders for outlier detection, sequence models, Shapley values, etc
Experience querying and manipulating data from relational databases and other data warehouse structures
Ability to maintain momentum on multiple projects in parallel and manage fluctuating deadlines and priorities
Demonstrated collaboration skills working in a team environment across multiple sites and multiple business units
Unique Requirements

The candidate selected for this role is required to have special clearance from the Royal Canadian Mounted Police. To see if you are eligible for this clearance, please review the section 201 on the Federal Government site (http://iss-ssi.pwgsc-tpsgc.gc.ca/msi-ism/ch2-prt1-eng.html)
What is in it for you?
Competitive salary and bonus structure influenced by market range data
Entitlement to flexible benefits and 4 weeks vacation
A friendly, collaborative and inclusive culture
Being part of our Analytics community, where we share best practices and broaden skill-sets
Interested in applying? Submit a job application by clicking “Apply” and complete an online assessment within 24 hours of submitting your job application using the link below.
Click on this link: https://apply.careerspark.com/j/xv9v0D6Jie36/l/JVxGM3OtFygF

to complete the online assessment after you submit your application. You will need to register with our partner Career Spark, using the same e-mail address used for your job application. If you complete this assessment before submitting your job application then you must return to this job posting again to complete your online job application by clicking “Apply”.

115,Technical Analyst I,"Toronto, ON",University Health Network,https://ca.indeed.com/rc/clk?jk=29cae3bb1be96196&fccid=2bef55e014d470c4&vjs=3,"[[

,

University Health Network (UHN) is looking for an experienced professional to fill the key role of Technical Analyst I in our STTARR Department.
Transforming lives and communities through excellence in care, discovery and learning.

The University Health Network, where “above all else the needs of patients come first”, encompasses Toronto Rehabilitation Institute, Toronto General Hospital, Toronto Western Hospital, Princess Margaret Cancer Centre and the Michener Institute of Education at UHN. The breadth of research, the complexity of the cases treated, and the magnitude of its educational enterprise has made UHN a national and international resource for patient care, research and education. With a long tradition of groundbreaking firsts and a purpose of “Transforming lives and communities through excellence in care, discovery and learning”, the University Health Network (UHN), Canada’s largest research teaching hospital, brings together over 16,000 employees, more than 1,200 physicians, 8,000+ students, and many volunteers. UHN is a caring, creative place where amazing people are amazing the world.

University Health Network (UHN) is a research hospital affiliated with the University of Toronto and a member of the Toronto Academic Health Science Network. The scope of research and complexity of cases at UHN have made it a national and international source for discovery, education and patient care. Research across UHN's five research institutes spans the full spectrum of diseases and disciplines, including cancer, cardiovascular sciences, transplantation, neural and sensory sciences, musculoskeletal health, rehabilitation sciences, and community and population health. Find out about our purpose, values and principles here.

The STTARR Computational / Image Analysis Core is looking to hire a technical analyst/programmer for development of algorithms for medical image quantification and analysis. The analyst will join a dynamic image analysis team comprised of scientists, technicians and programmers and help develop analytical tools which quantify imaging data to solve important basic and clinical research questions.

The ideal candidate would have a solid foundation in software development as well as knowledge of computer vision and machine learning. Good time management skills are a must. Knowledge of biology is useful but not required, however good communication skills are essential as the analyst will be interacting with researchers from a variety of disciplines.

This role covers a broad range of different tasks, equipment and technologies offering unique opportunities to gain experience with state-of-the-art image processing and machine learning methods and to contribute to open-source software in an impactful area. The successful candidate will work in this fast-paced/multidisciplinary environment with a focus on the translation of innovative image processing concepts and techniques to clinical implementation.
Responsibilities
The primary responsibilities for this position include (but are not limited to):
Work effectively in a cross-functional team to deliver client-facing end-to-end solutions that deliver on existing and proposed deliverables.
• Design, implementation and verification of software solutions for image processing, segmentation and classification.
• Development of batch processing methodologies, image format conversion, image processing, feature extraction, and reporting including data summarization and visualization.
• Ensure that new software solutions are maintainable, of high quality, and well documented.
Port or modify existing algorithms to develop a set of inter-operable software modules to complement and expand on existing analysis solutions.
Keep abreast of, and be ready to learn and implement, relevant and new technologies in software development in a collaborative environment, image processing in particular.
Abide by applicable Hospital and departmental policies, procedures, guidelines, protocols and practices
Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in a STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Math) field, or equivalent
Proficiency in Python and its scientific or data science ecosystem
Past software development experience (2+ years) in an academic or industry environment
Knowledge of revision control systems (git)
• Capable of multi-tasking, prioritizing, and working independently
Ability to work effectively as a team member and across disciplines
Preferred Qualifications:
Knowledge of image processing/computer vision, particularly using machine learning or deep learning (PyTorch/Tensorflow)
Experience with interpreting and contributing to scientific literature
Experience in a consulting or other technical customer service
Past contributions to open-source software

If you are interested in making your contribution at UHN, please apply on-line. You will be asked to copy and paste as well as attach your resume and covering letter. You will also be required to complete some initial screening questions.

,

]]"

The Product Manager is a hands-on role responsible for delivering customer solutions and will be responsible for all facets and logistics associated with product development, and build projects documenting each step of the project scope in the SmartCharge Platform team. Product and Market Research:
Perform discovery interviews and conduct secondary research to identify and validate feature ideas and customer concerns.
Develop user stories for software team feature scoping and development.
Perform research on how users interact with our products.
Being available for helping to prioritize bug fixes based on business value and user impacts.

Ensure that feedback loops and requests are seamlessly integrated into product planning and development processes (e.g. unblock trending sales objections, adapt to a new market segment, disrupt with a new lower priced offering, pivot the solution to a better fit).
Collect, organise, and prioritize feature requests and improvements for SmartCharge Platform.
Balance short-term investments to support sales targets with long-term strategic investments.

Responsible for internal team coordination and meetings relating to communications, project reviews, and risk assessments.

Write new installation instructions as needed and submit design requests to the marketing team.

THIS POSITION IS LOCATED IN SURREY, BC, AND WILL REQUIRE RELOCATION.

,

METHOD Innovation Partners Inc. is a growing Designing, Engineering and Manufacturing company based in Surrey, BC, producing custom products for clients across North America. Our 35-person team manufactures everything from one-off products for the entertainment industry to high volume products we’ve developed and created ourselves that we market to distribution channels and end users in a variety of industries.

,

We are actively seeking a full time Mold / Jig Specialist / Pattern Maker to join our team.

,

Principally, you are responsible for creating and maintaining the molds, fixtures &
column2: other tooling that we use to produce small to large format thermoforming products. While this often involves woodworking and finish carpentry, this role can also involve steel &amp
column3:
aluminum fabrication/machining and fiberglass/composite work.

,

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES

,

We need an energetic, creative, self-motivated and committed individual who will:

,
  • Fabricate, assemble, glue, sand, coat and finalize patterns, thermoforming molds, fixtures and various jigs for other processes
  • Safely setup and operate wood working and conventional milling equipment
  • Safely setup and operate MIG welding equipment for aluminum and steel an asset
  • Machine and fabricate components to close tolerances
  • Have the ability to read drawings
  • Inspect and test final tooling prior to production
  • Assist in the design or design of molds, jigs and fixtures
  • Assist with repair and preventive maintenance tasks
  • Identify equipment and tooling maintenance requirements
  • Promote a safe work environment and maintain housekeeping standards
  • Continuously seek opportunities for improvement
,

REQUIREMENTS

,

Key Competencies

,
  • Minimum of 3 year experience working as a mold/jig/cabinet maker
  • 3 years’ experience in industrial manufacturing. Plastic manufacturing is a plus
  • CNC programming and machining experience is considered an asset.
  • Have a thorough knowledge of composite products (advanced skills in creating and repairing composite tooling) an asset
  • Be willing to relocate to Surrey, BC
,

column4:

Who We Are:

,

Siva Creative is a quickly growing full service Growth Marketing Agency with our head office located in Barrie and our clients located all over the world. We are a team of experts who specialize in everything custom
column2:
web development, application and software solutions and integrations, design, branding, SEO, copy writing, AI, predictive purchasing, machine learning, AR, VR, Google Analytics, Ads, Social Media…..the list goes on. If it’s digital, we do it. If its not digital, we probably do that too.

We love our clients and have ongoing relationships with them. We are an extension to their team. It is a fun, high efficient and effectively paced work flow. We are a family who relies on each other to deliver the best quality to our clients. Each employee is empowered to take ownership in ensuring each of our clients are happy with our work.

,

What we are looking for:

We are currently looking for the Best PPC Expert to join our team! The ideal candidate will have strong knowledge and experience with Google Ads and Social Media Ads, and be able to work both independently as well as in a team. You should be able to meet deadlines and have great time management skills, a friendly telephone manner for support purposes and excellent written and verbal communication skills. We have a great family oriented culture and we are looking for someone who wants to grow with our team.

,

Each year the US and Canadian governments give out billions of dollars in R&
column2:
D tax credits to fund businesses, but the application process is cumbersome and time-consuming.

,

Boast.AI is building the future of tax credit recovery with artificial intelligence so companies can get more money, faster for less time and risk.

,

Boast’s mission is to help innovative companies become successful and we’ve built a community of 60k+ technology professionals called Traction to support that mission, bringing leaders from the fastest growing companies like Google, Shopify, Twilio, Slack, LinkedIn, Zoho, GitHub, Cloudflare, and many more to share advice via weekly webinars, monthly dinners, and an annual conference.

,

As the Chief Technology Officer (CTO), you will be a key member of the executive team and lead all strategy and execution of technology at Boast.AI.

,

Responsibilities

,
  • Retain, attract, and lead a diverse, inclusive, and increasingly distributed engineering team that can meet and exceed company goals in service of our mission
  • Work with the HR to set up a sustainable engineering hiring funnel
  • Ensure technical and career growth opportunities for team members
  • Troubleshoot personnel issues to ensure resolution inline with our values
  • Help plan and facilitate training and professional development activities
  • Manage and motivate the engineering team to deliver high-quality high-usability software on time and within budget
  • Direct and help the engineering team in pivotal decision making concerning infrastructure, architecture, security, and scalability
  • Develop and embed excellent communication practices with the engineering team and across the organization to ensure a high degree of alignment as we scale
  • Develop and embed a clear framework for productivity and velocity in order to ensure we’re scaling effectively
  • Maintain and scale the existing technologies and build on it
  • Keep abreast of the latest developments in fintech, artificial intelligence, machine learning, and software engineering
  • Ensure security standards and best practices are met
  • Review and optimize software development processes to ensure consistent and predictable delivery
  • Ensure proper performance monitoring of our tools and platforms
  • Serve as a part of the executive team to decide on strategies for short term and long term needs of the company and product roadmap
  • Participate in annual planning activities
  • Participate in activities to monitor the health of the business
  • Provide impactful insights into the company’s strategic direction
  • Lead the strategy, planning, and execution of the technology roadmap &
column3:
OKR’s
  • Lead estimating and capacity planning activities
  • Track and report on process-related metrics
  • Strategize and execute on IP development and manage the company’s IP portfolio
  • Provide regular market insights to ensure our technology strategy stays current and contributes to our competitive advantage
  • Work closely with our Product team to collectively bring high-quality software to our customers in accordance with requirements, quality standards, and timelines
  • Work closely with our Customer Success team to help troubleshoot any technical roadblocks and assist with any technology-related client escalation.
  • Work closely with our Sales team to help expand our client base and develop partnerships
  • Attend and contribute to key business development meetings
  • Represent Boast.AI at technology conferences and at executive level customer engagements

128,Research Scientist - Neural Interface Interactions,"Brampton, ON",Facebook,https://ca.indeed.com/rc/clk?jk=a23f4eacd79dc029&fccid=1639254ea84748b5&vjs=3,"[[""Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started. "",
, ' At Facebook Reality Labs (FRL), our goal is to explore, innovate and design novel interfaces and hardware subsystems for virtual, augmented, and mixed reality experiences. We are looking for a skilled and motivated Research Scientist to join our team, whose mission is to unleash human potential by erasing the bottlenecks between user intent and action. We are specifically looking for a candidate with experience in HCI and interactive computing and who can work with a team of researchers who are exploring the potential of neural interfaces, which has grown out of the acquisition of CTRL-labs. More broadly, the chosen candidate will work with a diverse and highly interdisciplinary team of researchers and engineers and will have access to cutting edge technology, resources, and testing facilities. ',
, ' ',
  • Plan and execute cutting-edge research of forward-looking interactions that are uniquely enabled by neural interface technology
Collaborate with neuroscientists and machine learning experts to unlock and perfect new capabilities to build interactions upon
Create prototypes which explore neural interfaces in a variety of environments and situations

Measure and evaluate the performance and qualities of promising interactions, '\n',
, '\n',
  • Must obtain work authorization in the country of employment at the time of hire and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment
PhD in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, or related field
Experience working independently to design, execute, interpret, and present interactions research]]"

129,Technical Analyst I,"St. Catharines, ON",University Health Network,https://ca.indeed.com/rc/clk?jk=29cae3bb1be96196&fccid=2bef55e014d470c4&vjs=3,"[[

,

University Health Network (UHN) is looking for an experienced professional to fill the key role of Technical Analyst I in our STTARR Department.
Transforming lives and communities through excellence in care, discovery and learning.

The University Health Network, where “above all else the needs of patients come first”, encompasses Toronto Rehabilitation Institute, Toronto General Hospital, Toronto Western Hospital, Princess Margaret Cancer Centre and the Michener Institute of Education at UHN. The breadth of research, the complexity of the cases treated, and the magnitude of its educational enterprise has made UHN a national and international resource for patient care, research and education. With a long tradition of groundbreaking firsts and a purpose of “Transforming lives and communities through excellence in care, discovery and learning”, the University Health Network (UHN), Canada’s largest research teaching hospital, brings together over 16,000 employees, more than 1,200 physicians, 8,000+ students, and many volunteers. UHN is a caring, creative place where amazing people are amazing the world.

University Health Network (UHN) is a research hospital affiliated with the University of Toronto and a member of the Toronto Academic Health Science Network. The scope of research and complexity of cases at UHN have made it a national and international source for discovery, education and patient care. Research across UHN's five research institutes spans the full spectrum of diseases and disciplines, including cancer, cardiovascular sciences, transplantation, neural and sensory sciences, musculoskeletal health, rehabilitation sciences, and community and population health. Find out about our purpose, values and principles here.

The STTARR Computational / Image Analysis Core is looking to hire a technical analyst/programmer for development of algorithms for medical image quantification and analysis. The analyst will join a dynamic image analysis team comprised of scientists, technicians and programmers and help develop analytical tools which quantify imaging data to solve important basic and clinical research questions.

The ideal candidate would have a solid foundation in software development as well as knowledge of computer vision and machine learning. Good time management skills are a must. Knowledge of biology is useful but not required, however good communication skills are essential as the analyst will be interacting with researchers from a variety of disciplines.

This role covers a broad range of different tasks, equipment and technologies offering unique opportunities to gain experience with state-of-the-art image processing and machine learning methods and to contribute to open-source software in an impactful area. The successful candidate will work in this fast-paced/multidisciplinary environment with a focus on the translation of innovative image processing concepts and techniques to clinical implementation.
Responsibilities
The primary responsibilities for this position include (but are not limited to):
Work effectively in a cross-functional team to deliver client-facing end-to-end solutions that deliver on existing and proposed deliverables.
• Design, implementation and verification of software solutions for image processing, segmentation and classification.
• Development of batch processing methodologies, image format conversion, image processing, feature extraction, and reporting including data summarization and visualization.
• Ensure that new software solutions are maintainable, of high quality, and well documented.
Port or modify existing algorithms to develop a set of inter-operable software modules to complement and expand on existing analysis solutions.
Keep abreast of, and be ready to learn and implement, relevant and new technologies in software development in a collaborative environment, image processing in particular.
Abide by applicable Hospital and departmental policies, procedures, guidelines, protocols and practices
Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in a STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Math) field, or equivalent
Proficiency in Python and its scientific or data science ecosystem
Past software development experience (2+ years) in an academic or industry environment
Knowledge of revision control systems (git)
• Capable of multi-tasking, prioritizing, and working independently
Ability to work effectively as a team member and across disciplines
Preferred Qualifications:
Knowledge of image processing/computer vision, particularly using machine learning or deep learning (PyTorch/Tensorflow)
Experience with interpreting and contributing to scientific literature
Experience in a consulting or other technical customer service
Past contributions to open-source software

If you are interested in making your contribution at UHN, please apply on-line. You will be asked to copy and paste as well as attach your resume and covering letter. You will also be required to complete some initial screening questions.

,

]]"
